children.definition: strong-toothed, Hsch. (glossed by καρτερούμενοι).

definition: κρατερός, ά, όν, Ep. form of καρτερός,

children.definition: strong, stout, mighty, in Hom. mostly of bodily strength, κρατερός περ ἐὼν καὶ χερσὶ πεποιθώς Il. 16.624, cf. 6.97, Pi. I. 5(4).31, etc.; epith. of Ares, Il. 2.515; of lions, Od. 4.335; χεῖρες ib. 288, Pi. P. 11.18: with collat. notion of stern, harsh, of Hades, Il. 13.415, cf. 21.566.

data.quote: κρατερός περ ἐὼν καὶ χερσὶ πεποιθώς

children.definition: mighty, fierce, κ. ὑσμίνας 2.345; ἀνάγκη 6.458; κρατερῆφι βίηφιν 21.501; σθένος B. 17.40; πάλα Id. 10.20; βέλος, τόξον, Il. 5.104, 8.279; βιός Od. 24.170; δεσμός, δεσμοί, Il. 5.386, Od. 8.336; hard, χῶρος h.Merc. 354; σίδηρος ὅπερ κρατερώτατός ἐστιν Hes. Th. 864.

strong, vehement, λύσσα Il. 9.239; ἔρις 13.358; μένος 7.38; πένθος 11.249; ἄλγεα Od. 15.232: of acts and words, κ. ἀμφίβασις Il. 5.623; κ. μῦθος a harsh, rough speech, 1.25; μῦθον ἀπηνέα τε κ. τε 15.202.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. - ρῶς strongly, stoutly, μάχεσθαι 12.152; ἑστάμεναι 15.666; ἔχεσθαι 16.501, 17.559; νεμεσᾶν 13.16; κὰδ δʼ ἔβαλε κ. dashed roughly to earth, Od. 4.344; κ. ἀγόρευσεν, ἀπέειπεν, sternly, Il. 8.29, 9.431; in Prose, Anon ap. Stob. 4.31.34.—Once in Trag., κ. γυιοπέδαι A. Pr. 168 (anap.); elsewh. καρτερός. ( κορτερά· κρατερά, ἰσχυρά, Hsch., is prob. Aeol.)

stout-hearted, dauntless, epith. of Heracles, Il. 14.324; the Dioscuri, Od. 11.299; Odysseus, 4.333; a wild beast, Il. 10.184; ἀδάμαντος ἔχον κρατερόφρονα θυμόν Hes. Op. 147, cf. Orph. Fr. 164; Διὸς κρατερόφρονι κούρῃ, of Athena, IG 1(2).503.
bronze, Hsch.
strong-hoofed, solid-hoofed, ἵπποι Il. 5.329, 16.724, al.; ἡμίονοι 24.277, Od. 6.253; strong-clawed, λύκοι κρατερώνυχες ἠδὲ λέοντες 10.218; with strong nails, χείρ Matro Conv. 28.

definition: κράτεσφι [ α-], Ep. dat. of κράς (q.v.).

children.definition: stone or metal blocks on which a spit rests, Il. 9.214, cf. Sch., Paus.Gr. Fr. 236; μολύβδινοι κ. Eup. 171, cf. IG 2(2).1425.388 (written κραδευταί ib. 1425.415, 1541.20).
stones which support a pavement, ib. 7.3073.105, al.(Lebad.).
pigs of specified weight, IG 1(2).371.13.
pf. κεκράτευκα, IG 14.1794.

definition: κρατέω, Aeol. κρετέω, aor. inf. κρέτησαι Sapph. Supp. 9.5:— Med., aor. ἐπι-κρατησάμενοι v.l. in Gal. UP 6.13:— Pass., fut. κρατήσομαι Aristid. 1.501 J. and, with v.l. κρατηθήσομαι, Th. 4.9:—

children.definition: to be strong, powerful: hence,

children.label: I
children.definition: rule, hold sway, Ἤλιδα . . , ὅθι κρατέουσιν Ἐπειοί Od. 13.275, 15.298; μέγα κρατέων ἤνασσε with mighty sway . . , Il. 16.172; ἅπας δὲ τραχύς, ὅστις ἂν νέον κρατῇ A. Pr. 35; ὁ κρατῶν the ruler, Id. Ag. 951, 1664, S. Ant. 738, etc.; θῶπτε τὸν κρατοῦντʼ ἀεί A. Pr. 937; οἱ κρατοῦντες Id. Ch. 267, S. OT 530, etc.; τὸ κρατοῦν E. Andr. 133 (lyr.), Pl. Lg. 714c, Arist. Pol. 1255a15; ἡ κρατοῦσα the lady of the house, A. Ch. 734.

data.quote: ἅπας δὲ τραχύς, ὅστις ἂν νέον κρατῇ

children.definition: rule among, μέγα κρατέεις νεκύεσσιν Od. 11.485; ἀνδράσι καὶ θεοῖσι 16.265; Φθίᾳ rule in Phthia, Pi. N. 4.50; ἐν Ἰλιάδι χθονί E. El. 4.

to be lord or master of, rule over, πάντων Ἀργείων, πάντων, Il. 1.79, 288, cf. Od. 15.274; Ὀλύμπου A. Pr. 149 (lyr.); δωμάτων Id. Ag. 1673; ὅπλων S. Aj. 1337; κ. τοῦ βίου to be master of . . , And. 1.137; αὑτοῦ κ. S. Aj. 1099, Antipho 5.26, cf. S. OC 405; ἡδονῶν καὶ ἐπιθυμιῶν Pl. Smp. 196c, etc.; τῶν πραγμάτων D. 2.27; τοῦ μὴ πείθεσθαι τοῖς νόμοις κρατῆσαι to be above obedience . . , X. Lac. 4.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: conquer, prevail, get the upper hand, abs., A. Ag. 324, etc.; πολλῷ ἐκράτησαν Hdt. 5.77; εἰ τὰ τοῦ Μήδου κρατήσειε Th. 3.62; ὁ μὴ πειθόμενος κρατεῖ Pl. Phdr. 272b; ἔνθα τἀναιδὲς κρατεῖ Diph. 111: c. dat. modi, κ. τῇ γνώμῃ prevail in opinion, Hdt. 9.42; πάλᾳ, ἱπποδρομίᾳ, Pi. O. 8.20, I. 3.13; μάχῃ E. HF 612; ταῖς ναυσί Ar. Ach. 648; τῷ Φοινίκων ναυτικῷ Th. 1.16; also θουρίῳ ἐν Ἄρει S. Aj. 614 (lyr.); ἐν τοῖς πολέμοις Ar. Pl. 184: c.acc.cogn., κ. στάδιον B. 6.15, cf. 7; ὀκτὼ νίκας E. Epigr. 1; τὸν ἀγῶνα D. 21.18; τὴν μάχην v.l. for τῇ μάχῃ in D.S. 18.30; τὴν πρεσβείαν Philostr. VS 1.21.6; πάντα in all things, S. OT 1522; οἱ κρατοῦντες the conquerors, X. An. 3.2.26; τὰ κατὰ πόλεμον κρατούμενα τῶν κρατούντων εἶναί φασιν Arist. Pol. 1255a7.

data.quote: τὰ κατὰ πόλεμον κρατούμενα τῶν κρατούντων εἶναί φασιν

children.label: b
children.definition: to be superior, πλήθους ἕκατι ναυσὶν κρατῆσαι A. Pers. 338: abs., to be the best, Critias 2.7 D.

children.label: c
children.definition: prevail, become current, φάτις κρατεῖ A. Supp. 293, S. Aj. 978; λόγος κ. A. Pers. 738; νόμιμα δὲ τὰ Χαλκιδικὰ ἐκράτησεν Th. 6.5; κρατεῖ ἡ φήμη παρά τισι Plb. 9.26.11.
inf., prevail so that, κ. τῷ πλήθει ὥστε μὴ αὐτίκα τὰς πύλας ἀνοίγεσθαι Th. 4.104: impers., κατθανεῖν κρατεῖ ʼtis better to . . , A. Ag. 1364; κρατεῖ μὴ γιγνώσκοντʼ ἀπολέσθαι E. Hipp. 248 (anap.).

data.quote: κ. τῷ πλήθει ὥστε μὴ αὐτίκα τὰς πύλας ἀνοίγεσθαι

children.definition: conquer, prevail over, τῶν ἐναντίων S. Fr. 85, cf. OC 646, A. Th. 955 (lyr.), etc.; κ. τινὸς τὸν ἀγῶνα Philostr. Her. 2.5: metaph., τό τοι νομισθὲν τῆς ἀληθείας κρατεῖ S. Fr. 86; κ. τῆς διαβολῆς get the better of it, Lys. 19.53; ὁ λόγος τοῦ ἔργου ἐκράτει surpassed, went beyond it, Th. 1.69; ἡ φύσις . . τῶν διδαγμάτων κρατεῖ is better than . . , Men. Mon. 213, cf. 169.

data.quote: τό τοι νομισθὲν τῆς ἀληθείας κρατεῖ

children.label: b
children.definition: digest, assimilate, Hp. VM 3, 14, Mnesith. ap. Ath. 2.54b, Phylotim.ib. 3.79c:— Pass., Hp. Epid. 6.5.15; τῆς τροφῆς μὴ κρατηθείσης Plu. QConv. 2.654b.

conquer, master, Pi. N. 10.25, A. Pr. 215, Th. 189, E. Alc. 490, Ar. Nu. 1346, Av. 420, X. An. 7.6.32, etc.; μάχῃ, τῷ πολέμῳ τινά, Th. 6.2, Aeschin. 2.30; τῷ λόγῳ τινά Ar. V. 539; πάχει μάκει τε in . . , Pi. P. 4.245; outdo, τοὺς φίλους εὖ ποιῶν X. Hier. 11.15; τῷ διαφθαρῆναι χρήμασιν ἢ μὴ κεκράτηκα Φίλιππον D. 18.247; surpass, κρατεῖ δὲ ὁ τῆς ἡδονῆς [βίος] τὸν τῆς φρονήσεως Pl. Phlb. 12a:— Pass., to be overcome, A. Th. 750 (lyr.), etc.; ὕπνῳ Id. Eu. 148 (lyr.); ὑπὸ τοῦ ὕπνου Hdt. 2.121.δʹ; ὑπὸ τῶν ἡδονῶν Pl. Lg. 633e.

data.quote: τῷ διαφθαρῆναι χρήμασιν ἢ μὴ κεκράτηκα Φίλιππον
κρατεῖ δὲ ὁ τῆς ἡδονῆς [βίος] τὸν τῆς φρονήσεως

children.label: III
children.definition: become master of, get possession of, τῆς ἀρχῆς, τῶν νεκρῶν, Hdt. 1.92, 4.111; πολλὰ φρονέοντα μηδενὸς κ. Id. 9.16; σέθεν A. Supp. 387; οὔπω ἡ βουλή σου ἐκράτει Lys. 13.26; κ. τῆς γῆς Th. 3.6; ναυσὶ τῆς θαλάσσης Pl. Mx. 240a; κ. τῆς λέξεως have it at command, remember it, Ath. 7.275b; master by the intellect, πάντων τῶν τῆς ἱστορίας μερῶν Plb. 16.20.2:— Pass., to be mastered, δεῖ ἐν ταῖς τέχναις καὶ ἐπιστήμαις ταῦτα κρατεῖσθαι Arist. Pol. 1331b38, cf. Po. 1456a10 (prob.for κροτεῖσθαι).

data.quote: δεῖ ἐν ταῖς τέχναις καὶ ἐπιστήμαις ταῦτα κρατεῖσθαι

children.label: IV
children.definition: lay hold of, τῆς χειρός LXX Ge. 19.16, Ev.Matt. 9.25, Ev.Marc. 9.27.

seize, win and keep, esp.by force, πᾶσαν αἶαν A. Supp. 255; θρόνους S. OC 1381; seize, hold fast, arrest, τινα Batr. 63, Plb. 8.18.8, Ev.Matt. 14.3; τένοντα Batr. 233; τὰς χεῖράς τινος PLips. 40iii2 (iv/v A.D.); secure, grasp, τὴν ἀκατονόμαστον Τριάσα Zos.Alch. p.230B.

hold up, support, τινα D.H. 4.38; maintain a military post, X. An. 5.6.7; hold fast, τὰς παραδόσεις 2 Ep.Thess. 2.15; keep, retain, PTeb. 61 ( b).229 (ii B.C.):— Pass., οὐκ ἦν δυνατὸν κρατεῖσθαι αὐτὸν ὑπʼ αὐτοῦ (sc. τοῦ θανάτου) Act.Ap. 2.24; ἡ κτῆσις τοῖς τέκνοις κεκράτηται has been reserved for, settled upon, POxy. 237 viii 36 (ii A.D.).
possess a title to, κ. καὶ κυριεύειν c.gen., PTeb. 319.19 (iii A.D.), etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: sequester, place under embargo, OGI 1669.23 ( Pass., Egypt, i A.D.), BGU 742 iii 6 ( Pass., ii A.D.).

hold in the hand, ὁ κρατῶν τοὺς ἑπτὰ ἀδτέρας ἐν τῇ δεξιᾷ αὐτοῦ Apoc. 2.1; πόαν Dsc. 3.93; ἄρτον Plu. Fort. 2.99d; σκῆπτρον Ath. 7.289c, cf. Luc. Am. 44, Ach.Tat. 1.6, etc.; δακτύλιον PMag.Lond. 46.451 (iv A.D.).

data.quote: ὁ κρατῶν τοὺς ἑπτὰ ἀδτέρας ἐν τῇ δεξιᾷ αὐτοῦ

children.definition: endure, put up with, τὸν ἀργυροπράτην POxy. 1844 (vi A.D.).

children.label: V
children.definition: control, command, A. Ag. 10, E. Hec. 282:— Pass., αἰσχρὰ τῷ νόμῳ κρατούμενα controlled by . . , Ar. Av. 755; κρατεῖσθαι ὑπὸ τοῦ προβουλεύματος D.H. 9.52; διαθέσει Porph. Sent. 27.

children.label: VI
children.definition: repair, make good, τὸ βεδὲκ (Hebr.) τοῦ οἴκου LXX 4 Ki. 12.5.
support, of a bandage, Gal. 18(2).538, Heracl. ap. Orib. 48.15.3, Heliod.ib. 27.3; fulcrum, Id.ib. 49.19.2.
grasp, grip of the hand, Procl. Par.Ptol. 36.
handle, Sch. Luc. JTr. 31, Icar. 10.

definition: κρατήρ, Ion. and Ep. κρητήρ, ῆρος, ὁ, ( κεράννυμι)

children.definition: mixing vessel, esp. bowl, in which wine was mixed with water, κ. ἀργύρεος, χρύσεος, Il. 23.741, 219; [ κ.] ἀργύρεος ἔστιν ἅπας, χρυσῷ δʼ ἐπὶ χείλεα κεκράανται Od. 4.615; οἶνον δʼ ἐκ κρητῆρος ἀφυσσόμενοι δεπάεσσιν ἔκχεον Il. 3.295, cf. 247; κρητῆρι δὲ οἶνον μίσγον ib. 269; κρητῆρα κερασσάμενος Od. 7.179, 13.50; οἶνον ἔμισγον ἐνὶ κρητῆρσι καὶ ὕδωρ 1.110, cf. Sapph. 51, Alc. 45, S. OC 159 (lyr.), Ar. Ec. 841; κρατῆρα κεράσαι Orac. ap. D. 21.53, cf. Th. 6.32; κρητῆρα καὶ ὑποκρητήριον SIG 2 ( Sigeum, vi B.C.); πίνοντες κρητῆρας drinking bowls of wine, Il. 8.232; κρητῆρα στήσασθαι ἐλεύθερον to set up a bowl of wine to be drunk in honour of the deliverance 6.528, cf. Od. 2.431; κρητῆρα ἐπιστέψασθαι ποτοῖο, v. ἐπιστέφω; κρατῆρος μέρος μετασχεῖν A. Ch. 291; σπονδὴ τρίτου κρατῆρος S. Fr. 425.

data.quote: κ.] ἀργύρεος ἔστιν ἅπας, χρυσῷ δʼ ἐπὶ χείλεα κεκράανται
οἶνον δʼ ἐκ κρητῆρος ἀφυσσόμενοι δεπάεσσιν ἔκχεον
οἶνον ἔμισγον ἐνὶ κρητῆρσι καὶ ὕδωρ

children.definition: κ. ἀοιδᾶν, of the messenger who bears an ode, Pi. O. 6.91; κ. κακῶν, of a sycophant, Ar. Ach. 937 (lyr.); τοσόνδε κρατῆρʼ ἐν δόμοις κακων πλήσας . . ἐκπίνει A. Ag. 1397; αἵματος κρατῆρα πολιτικοῦ στῆσαι, of civil war, D.H. 7.44.

data.quote: τοσόνδε κρατῆρʼ ἐν δόμοις κακων πλήσας . . ἐκπίνει

children.definition: Cup, Ptol. Tetr. 27.

children.label: II
children.definition: any cup-shaped hollow, basin in a rock, S. OC 1593, cf. Pl. Phd. 111d.
mouth of a volcano, crater, Arist. Mu. 400a33 (pl.), Plb. 34.11.12 (pl.), Luc. Trag. 23.
bowl for compounding drugs, etc., Dsc. 4.150, Zos.Alch. p.234B.
Mélanges dʼarch. et d’épigr. p.457 (Thrace, κρατηριακος lapis).

definition: κρατηρίζω, Ion. κρητηρ- prob. in SIG 57.24 ( Milet., v B.C.):—in aor. Pass. κἠκρατηρίχ<θ>ημες,

children.definition: drink out of the κρατήρ, i.e. get drunk, as we might say, drink from the bottle instead of the glass, Sophr. 106 (prob.l., cf. ἐκρατηρίχθημεν· ἐμεθύσθημεν, Hsch.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., mix a bowl of wine, κρητηρίσα<ντες κρητῆρα>ς τέσσερας prob. in SIG l.c., cf. AB 274; esp.for the orgies. D. 18.259, Phot.

definition: κρατήριον, Ion. κρητ-, τό, Dim. of κρατήρ, Hp. Nat.Mul. 34; as a measure, POxy. 2049 (vi A.D.):—also κρατηρ-ίδιον, τό, in pl., IG 7.3099 (Lebad.), J. AJ 3.6.7:
κρατηρίσκος, ὁ, IG ΙΙ(2).203 A 35 ( Delos, iii B.C.), Ath. 11.479c; κ. τοῦ ὀφθαλμοῦ

children.definition: sockets, Hsch. (pl.).
bearing a bowl, Ῥέα Sch. Nic. Al. 217.
Pi. Fr. 16.
conquering in the fight, Pi. P. 9.86.
victorious in the footrace, Pi. P. 10.16.
victorious in the race, ἅρμα Pi. N. 9.4.
might, power, dominion, LXX Wi. 6.3, Man. ap. J. Ap. 1.26.
ἡ Καίσαρος κ. (sc. Αἰγύπτου), an era in Egypt (viz. the capture of Alexandria, 30 B.C.), BGU 174 (i A.D.), PFay. 89.2 (i A.D.), etc.
accession of an Emperor, BGU 362iv6, al. (iii A.D.).
prevalence, predominance, ἡ τῆς ἀπλανοῦς κ. Simp. in Cael. 475.30, 476.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: possession, βίου κ. BMus.Inscr. 918 (Halic.); κ. τοῦ ἐν ὕλῃ σκοτεινοῦ Plot. 1.6.3.
title to possession, Mitteis Chr. 31 iii 32 (ii B.C.); κ. καὶ κυρεία BGU 1187.7, etc.
retention, κ. ἐπίμονος σπέρματος (i.e. conception) Sor. 1.43; opp. ἔκκρισις, Gal. 8.440.

children.label: b
children.definition: κ. τῶν ὑδάτων, i.e. drought, Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.184.
holding firm, steadying, Gal. 18(2).826, Olymp. in Mete. 96.11.
of Crates, γραφή Str. 2.3.8.
one must keep to, τῆς δυμμετρίας Aët. 9.35.
one who holds or possesses, ἱερῶν Procl. Par.Ptol. 228.
fit for winning, νίκη κ. δύναμις Pl. Def. 414a.
ruling, controlling, δύναμις κ. τῶν προνοουμένων Procl. Inst. 121; κ. τῶν ὅλων Id. in Ti. 1.69; αἱ κ. δυνάμεις, opp. αἱ ὑπουργικαί, Id. in Prm. p.736 S.
promoting retention (cf. κράτησις II 3), συλλήψεως Aët. 1.142.
predominant, Vett.Val. 333.5.
capable of being grasped, mastered, διανοίᾳ Porph. Marc. 8.
Heraclid.Lemb. 5.
ruling star, Ptol. Tetr. 198.

definition: κρατίζομαι, f.l. for κραστιζομαι in Sophr. 166.

children.definition: used by the Comic poet Cratinus, ὄνομα D.H. Rh. 11.10; μέτρον Heph. 15.21.
excellency, POxy. 1204.15 (iii/iv A.D.).

to be mightiest, best, most excellent, ὁ κρατιστεύων λόγος Pi. Fr. 180; ὦ κρατιστεύων κατʼ ὄμμα, of the Sun, S. Tr. 102 (lyr.); ὁ κ. the conqueror, opp. ὁ ἡττηθείς, Arist. HA 614a4; τὰ κ. J. BJ 1.2.8.
to be superior, τῷ σώματι καὶ τῇ ψυχῇ X. Mem. 1.4.14; ἔν τινι ib. 2.6.26; τἆλλα Id. Cyr. 1.5.1.
πάντων And. 3.18; τῶν ἡλικιωτῶν κ. ἐν τοῖς ἀγῶσι to be first of them, Isoc. 9.22.
PMag.Leid.V. 7.15.
by choosing the best, Poll. 1.176.

definition: κράτιστος, η, ον, Ep. κάρτ- (as always in Hom.), isolated Superl. from κρατύς,

children.definition: strongest, mightiest, Il. 1.266, etc.; θεῶν κ., i.e. Zeus. Pi. O. 14.13; κ. Ἑλλήνων, i.e. Achilles, S. Ph. 3: in Prose, εἰ τοὺς κ. ἐνικήσαμεν Th. 7.67; Λημνίων τὸ κ. the best of their men, Id. 5.8; τὸ δυνάμεως κ. the strength or flower of . . , X. Cyr. 6.1.28, etc.; of things, καρτίστην . . μάχην fiercest fight, Il. 6.185; δεσμὸς κ. Ti.Locr. 99a.

best, most excellent, as Sup. of ἀγαθός, Pi. I. 1.17, S. Ant. 1050, etc.: colloquially, " ἄνδρα κ. εἰπών Thphr. Char. 5.2; οἱ κράτιστοι the aristocracy, X. HG 7.1.42, v. ἀγαθός I; τὰ κ. τῆς χώρας ib. 3.4.20.

children.label: b
children.definition: κράτιστε Θεόφιλε Ev.Luc. 1.3; esp. = Lat. egregius, ὁ κ. ἡγεμών PFay. p.33 (i A.D.); ὁ κ. ἐπίτροπος BGU 891 (ii A.D.); ἡ κ., of a woman of the equester ordo, IG 14. 1346; also, = Lat. clarissimus, of Senators, ὁ κ. ἀνθύπατος ib. 9(1).61; ὁ κ. συγκλητικός IGRom. 3.581, etc.; ἡ κ. βουλή POxy. 2108.6 (iii A. D.).

children.label: c
children.definition: κ. τὴν ψυχήν Th. 2.40; πάντων πάντα κ. best of all in . . , X. An. 1.9.2; ἔν τινι Id. Mem. 3.4.5; εἴς τι Pl. Phlb. 67b; περί τι Id. Plt. 257a; πρός τι X. HG 3.4.16: c. inf., best at doing, Th. 2.81, Pl. Phdr. 267d, X. Mem. 1.4.1, etc.: c. part., τῶν ἡλίκων κ. εἶναι ἀκοντίζων καὶ τοξεύων Id. Cyr. 1.3.15.

data.quote: τῶν ἡλίκων κ. εἶναι ἀκοντίζων καὶ τοξεύων

children.definition: inf., φυγέειν κάρτιστον to flee were best, Od. 12.120, cf. E. El. 379, Ar. Eq. 80, etc.: in pl., κράτιστα . . ἑλεῖν E. Med. 384: abs., ὅπερ κ. the main point, Th. 1.143.
Adv. usages, ἀπὸ τοῦ κρατίστου in all good faith, Plb. 8.17.4; κατὰ τὸ κ. D.H. 2.22: neut. pl. κράτιστα as Adv., X. HG 3.4.16, Ages. 1.25.—The Comp. in use is κρείσσων (q.v.).
devourer of heads or brains, Lyc. 1066.
head-born, θεός, of Athena, Porph. Antr. 32.

definition: κρατόδετον σφενδόνην δεδεμένην, τὰ γὰρ ἄκρα τῆς σφενδόνης κεφαλὰς ἐκάλουν, Hsch. s.v. κραστόδετον (incomplete s.v. κρατόδετον).

children.definition: struck on the head, cj. Lob. for - παγής in Man. 4.284 (- παλής Koechly).
power, might, θεοῦ Gloss.

definition: κράτος [ᾰ], Ion. and Ep. κάρτος, εος, τό, both in Hom.; Aeol. κρέτος Alc. 25:—

children.definition: strength, might, in Hom. esp. of bodily strength, ἔπεφνε δόλῳ, οὔ τι κράτεΐ γε Il. 7.142; ἔχει ἥβης ἄνθος, ὅ τε κ. ἐστὶ μέγιστον 13.484, etc.; τὸ γὰρ αὖτε σιδήρου γε κ. ἐστίν this (i.e. τὸ βάψαι) is what gives strength to iron, Od. 9.393: generally, δικαία γλῶσσʼ ἔχει κ. μέγα S. Fr. 80; μηχανῆς ἔστω κ. A. Supp. 207; κατὰ κράτος with all oneʼs might or strength, πολιορκεῖσθαι Th. 1.64; πολεμεῖν Pl. Lg. 692d; ἐξελέγχεσθαι D. 34.20, etc.: freq. in phrase αἱρεῖν κατὰ κ. take by storm, Th. 8.100, Isoc. 4.119, etc.; also ἀνὰ κράτος διώκειν X. Cyr. 1.4.23; ἐλαύνειν Id. An. 1.8.1, etc.; ἀπὸ κράτους D.S. 17.34; πρὸς ἰσχύος κράτος, opp. λόγῳ, S. Ph. 594.

data.quote: ἔπεφνε δόλῳ, οὔ τι κράτεΐ γε
ἔχει ἥβης ἄνθος, ὅ τε κ. ἐστὶ μέγιστον

children.definition: Βία τε A. Pr. 12; K. καὶ Δίκη Id. Ch. 244.

children.label: II
children.definition: power, τοῦ γὰρ κ. ἐστὶ μέγιστον, of Zeus, Il. 2.118, etc.; τοῦ γὰρ κ. ἔστʼ ἐνὶ οἴκῳ Od. 1.359, cf. Il. 12.214; Ζηνὸς κ. Pi. O. 6.96, cf. A. Pr. 527 (lyr.); ἐκπίπτειν κράτους, of Zeus, ib. 948; τὸ κ. τοῦ θεοῦ LXX Ps. 61(62).11, etc.: pl., ὑποχείριος κράτεσιν ἀρσένων A. Supp. 393 (lyr.), cf. S. Ant. 485; esp. of political power, rule, sovereignty, ὁ μαιόμενος τὸ μέγα κρέτος ὀντρέψει τάχα τὰν πόλιν Alc. l.c.; τὸ κ. περιθεῖναί τινι Hdt. 1.129; ἐς τὸ πλῆθος φέρειν τὸ κ. Id. 3.81; τὸ πᾶν κ. ἔχειν to be all- powerful, Id. 7.3; ἀρχὴ καὶ κ. τυραννικόν S. OC 373; βασιλεὺς πρῶτος ἐν κράτει Ὀδρυσῶν ἐγένετο in real power, Th. 2.29; later τὸ κ. τῶν Ῥωμαίων POxy. 41i2 (iii/iv A. D.): in pl., κράτη καὶ θρόνους S. Ant. 173, cf. OT 586, etc.; θρόνων κράτη sovereign power, Id. Ant. 166.

data.quote: τοῦ γὰρ κ. ἔστʼ ἐνὶ οἴκῳ
ὁ μαιόμενος τὸ μέγα κρέτος ὀντρέψει τάχα τὰν πόλιν
ἐς τὸ πλῆθος φέρειν τὸ κ.

children.definition: power over, τὸ Περσέων κ. ἔχοντα Hdt. 3.69; τὸ κ. εἶχε τῆς στρατιῆς Id. 9.42; πᾶν κ. ἔχων χθονός A. Supp. 425 (lyr.); τῶν ἄλλων δαιμόνων E. Tr. 949; δὸς κ. τῶν σῶν δόμων A. Ch. 480; δωμάτων ἔχειν κ. Ar. Th. 871; τὸ τῆς θαλάσσης κ. Th. 1.143; μετὰ κράτους τῆς γῆς Id. 8.24; ὧν ἂν ᾖ τὸ κ. τῆς γῆς whoever have possession of the land, Id. 4.98; κ. ἔχειν ἑαυτοῦ Pl. Plt. 273a: pl., ἀστραπᾶν κράτη νέμων S. OT 201 (lyr.).
a power, an authority, Ἀχαιῶν δίθρονον κ. A. Ag. 109 (lyr.), cf. 619, Th. 127 (lyr.).

children.label: III
children.definition: mastery, victory, freq. in Hom., Il. 1.509, 6.387, Od. 21.280; κ. ἄρνυσθαι S. Ph. 838 (lyr.); νίκη καὶ κράτη A. Supp. 951; ἀέθλων κ. victory in . . , Pi. I. 8(7).4; νίκη καὶ κ. τῶν δρωμένων S. El. 85; κ. ἀριστείας the meed of highest valour, Id. Aj. 443; νίκη καὶ κ. πολεμίων Pl. Lg. 962a; κ. πολέμου καὶ νίκη D. 19.130.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ligaments, Hp. Mul. 2.167.
back of the hand, Poll. 2.144.

children.label: V
children.definition: Pythag. name for ten, Theol.Ar. 59.—This word and its derivs. take two forms, κρατ- and καρτ-; the latter is mostly Ep., as κάρτος, κάρτιστος, καρτύνω, but in κρατερός and καρτερός the reverse holds, v. κρατερός fin.; κρατέω, κρατύς have no form καρτ-. ( κρατ- and καρτ- from kṛt-, weak form of κρετ-, cf. κρέτος, κρέσσων.)
strengthening, making firm, Hp. Mul. 1.78; κρατυντήρια, τά, title of work of Democritus in support of his doctrines, S.E. M. 7.136, D.L. 9.47, Suid.; κρατυντήρια· κατισχύοντα, Hsch.

definition: κρατυντικός, ή, όν, = foreg., κ. φάρμακα, for loose teeth, Archig. ap. Gal. 12.873, v.l. in Dsc. 1.30, prob.l. in Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.34.3.

children.definition: confirmed, upheld, τὶν πάντα κρατυντά Orph. Fr. 47.6.
ruler, controller, πυρός PMag.Leid.W. 8.21.

strengthen, κ. τὰς Συρηκούσας Hdt. 7.156; τὴν πόλιν Th. 1.69; τείχη Id. 3.18; κ. τινὰ δορυφόροισι Hdt. 1.98; κ. ἑωυτὸν τῇ τυραννίδι ib. 100:—also in Med. (so only in Hom.), ἐκαρτύναντο φάλαγγας they strengthened their ranks, Il. 11.215, 12.415; κρατυνάμενοι [τὴν Ἄντανδρον] Th. 4.52, cf. 114; τὴν προβολήν Plu. Aem. 20; πίστεις κ. confirm their pledges, Th. 3.82; σπείραισιν ἐκαρτύναντο βοείαις χεῖρας Theoc. 22.80; ἐκαρτ. μέλαθρον A.R. 2.1087; οἵ μιν . . ἐκαρτ. κεραυνῷ Id. 1.510; καρτ. τὴν αἰσυμνητείην Thrasyb. ap. D.L. 1.100:— Pass., wax strong, ἔσχε τὴν βασιληΐην καὶ ἐκρατύνθη Hdt. 1.13; τείχεσιν ἐκεκράτυντο D.C. 40.36, cf. D.H. 3.72; ἐν χρόνῳ κρατυνθὲν ἔθος LXX Wi. 14.16.

children.label: b
children.definition: confirm an impression, S.E. M. 8.364 ( Pass.); an agreement, PLond. 1.113i51 (vi A. D.).
harden, opp. ἁπαλύνω, τοὺς πόδας ἀνυποδησίᾳ X. Lac. 2.3, cf. Gal. 4.748 ( Pass.):— Pass., ὀστέα κρατύνεται consolidate, Hp. Fract. 7.

children.label: II
children.definition: rule, govern, c.gen., S. OT 14, E. Ba. 660: c.acc., ἄκρα κρατύνων Emp. 100.19, cf. 73.2, A. Pers. 900 codd. (lyr.); πτόλιν Id. Supp. 699 (lyr.): c. acc. cogn., κράτος κ. Id. Ag. 1471 (lyr.): abs., Id. Pr. 150 (lyr.), 404 (lyr.); τὰ πρῶτα μὲν δόρει κρατύνων, πρῶτα δʼ οἰωνῶν ὁδοῖς S. OC 1314.

data.quote: τὰ πρῶτα μὲν δόρει κρατύνων, πρῶτα δʼ οἰωνῶν ὁδοῖς

children.definition: become master, get possession of, τῶν ὅπλων Id. Ph. 366, cf. 1059, 1161 (lyr.): c. acc., possess, λέκτρα Corinn. Supp. 2.55; βασιληΐδα τιμὰν κ. hold, exercise, E. Hipp. 1281 (lyr.), cf. A. Supp. 372 (lyr.); τὴν πολιτικὴν ἀρετήν Him. Or. 14.28.

children.label: III
children.definition: καρτύνειν βέλεα ply, throw them stoutly, Pi. O. 13.95; κ. ἐνὶ χερσὶν ἐρετμά A.R. 2.332.

children.label: IV
children.definition: inf., insist that . . , D.L. 7.83, cf. Procl. Hyp. 3.54.
strong, mighty, in Hom. always epith. of Hermes, κρατὺς Ἀργειφόντης Il. 16.181, 24.345, Od. 5.49. (For a doubtful fem. κράταια, v. κραταιίς.)
strength, firmness, Hp. Epid. 6.8.11.
ruler, potentate, of God, Gloss.
Ptol. Tetr. 164.

bay, Lyr.Adesp. 135; of ravens, croak, Arr. Epict. 3.1.37; of men, cry aloud, shout, D. 54.7, LXX 2 Es. 3.13, Ev.Jo. 18.40, Polem. Cyn. 40, Gal. 8.287; κ. μὴ θυμοῦ" Phld. Ir. p.70 W.; κραυγάζω κοὐκ ἐπακούει Riv.Fil. 57.380 ( Aptera).

definition: κραυγανάομαι, = foreg., παιδίον ἀσπαῖρόν τε καὶ κραυγανώμενον ( v.l. - γόμενον) Hdt. 1.111, cf.Sch. Call. Aet. Oxy. 2079.20 [Fr. 1.20 Pf.] .
Κραυγασίδης, ου, ὁ, as if a Patron. of κραύγασος, Croaker, name of a frog in Batr. 243.

children.definition: screaming, Diph. 16; censured by Phryn. 317.
bawler, shouter, Gloss.
crier, bawler, gloss on βαβάκτης, AB 223:—fem. κραυγ-άστρια, Hsch. s.v. μηκάδες.
vociferous, Procl. Par.Ptol. 230, Sch. Il. 1.575; τὸ κ. Sch. Ar. Pax 1078. Adv. - κῶς Sch. Ar. Eq. 485.

crying, screaming, shouting, τίς ἥδε κ.; Telecl. 35; κραυγὴν θεῖναι, στῆσαι, E. Or. 1510, 1529; ποιεῖν X. Cyr. 3.1.4; κραυγῇ χρῆσθαι Th. 2.4; κ. γίγνεται Lys. 13.71; rarely of a shout of joy, PPetr. 3p.334 (iii B. C.), Ev.Luc. 1.42: in pl., Aeschin. 1.34, Vett.Val. 2.35; κραυγὴ Καλλιόπης, as an instance of bad taste, cited from Dionys.Eleg. ( 7) by Arist. Rh. 1405a33.
that takes fright at a cry, Hsch.
woodpecker, Hsch.:—also κραυγόν (leg. - γών), Id.
fever, a disease in swine and cattle, Suid., Phot., prob. in GDI 5001 ( Gortyn).
suffer from fever, of cattle, Arist. HA 604a17; of swine, ib. 603b7.
become dry or parched, Ph. 2.174, D.C. 66.21.
Arist. HA 604a14; also, a disease of bees, prob. in Hsch. ( καυροώς cod.).

definition: κραῦρος (B), α, ον, also ος, ον Arist. PA 655a25:—

children.definition: brittle, friable ( κραῦρον τὸ τελέως ξηρόν, ὥστε καὶ πεπηγέναι διʼ ἔλλειψιν ὑγρότητος Id. GC 330a6), Pl. Ti. 60d ( Comp.); of wood, Thphr. HP 1.6.2, al., Eust. 1906.11; opp. μαλακός, γλίσχρος, Arist. PA l.c., GA 734b32; of meat, θερμότερον ἢ κραυρότερον ἢ μέσως ἔχον (apptly.) dry and cold, Eub. 7.

data.quote: κραῦρον τὸ τελέως ξηρόν, ὥστε καὶ πεπηγέναι διʼ ἔλλειψιν ὑγρότητος

children.definition: brittleness, opp. γλισχρότης, Thphr. HP 1.5.4, Gal. 6.799.

definition: κραῦσον τὸ πῦρ, Hsch. κράφα· ᾧ οἱ κηπουροὶ τοὺς βώλους ἀπάγουσιν, Id.

children.definition: flesh-hook, to take meat out of the pot, Ar. Eq. 772 (ubi v. Sch.), V. 1155, Anaxipp. 6.2, LXX 1 Ki. 2.14, PLond. 2.191.10 (ii A. D.), etc.: generally, hook to seize or drag by, Ar. Ec. 1002.
tearing off the flesh, Lyc. 759.

definition: κρεάγριον, τό, Dim. of κρεάγρα, IG 2(2).1541.13.

children.definition: AP 6.306 ( Aristo).

Dim. of κρέας, morsel, slice of meat, Ar. Pl. 227, Cephisod. 8, Hp. Epid. 7.3, Porph. Abst. 1.37: pl., Ar. Fr. 591, Alex. 110.15, X. Cyr. 1.4.13, Phld. Ir. p.41 W.; σφυρίδαν κρεδίων (sic) BGU 814.25 (iii A. D.): sg. written κρεάδινον Orib. Eup. 4.72.1.
distribution of meat, Inscr.Prien. 111.174 (i B. C.), IG 7.2712.68 (Acraeph.).
distribute meat, OGI 764.54 ( Pergam., ii B. C.), Inscr.Prien. 123.6 (i B. C.).

divide the flesh of a victim among the guests, l.c., Luc. Prom. 20; distribute meat, τῇ βουλῇ IG 2(2).847.25: generally, divide, cut piecemeal, D.S. 34.12:— Med., Sopat. 20: with pl. subject, divide among themselves, Theoc. 26.24.
distribution of meat, Theopomp.Hist. 205 (pl.), IG 2(2).1245.5, Luc. Prom. 5: pl., IG 2(2).334.25, Porph. Abst. 2.30.
one who distributes the flesh of victims, E. Cyc. 245: as Adj., mangling, τέκνων Lyc. 203, cf. 762.

definition: κρέας, τό, Dor. κρῆς (q.v.), Ep. κρεῖας dub. cj. in Anan. 5.3; Att. gen. κρέως S. Fr. 728; Cret. κρίως GDI 5128 ( Vaxos): pl. κρέα IG 1(2).84.26, etc.; gen. κρεῶν Od. 15.98, Hdt. 1.73, IG 1(2).10.7, Ar. Ra. 191, etc.; Ep. κρειῶν Il. 11.551, al., κρεάων [ᾰ] h.Merc. 130; dat. κρέασι Il. 12.311, κρέεσσι Orac. ap. Hdt. 1.47, κρεάεσσι Epic. in Arch.Pap. 7.4. [ κρέᾰ Hom., E. Cyc. 126, Ar. V. 363, al., κρέ) elided Od. 3.65, 470, Ar. Th. 558, κρέᾱ Antiph. 20 (s.v.l.).]:—

children.definition: flesh, meat, Od. 8.477, etc.; ἄρνειον κ. piece of lamb, Pherecr. 45, cf. Ar. Pl. 1137; ἐρίφειον Antiph. 222.6; τρία κρέα [ἢ] καὶ πλείω X. Cyr. 2.2.2; τέτταρα . . κρέα μικρά Antiph. 172.3 (anap.): pl., mostly in collect. sense, dressed meat, Od. 3.65, etc.; κ. ἑφθά Hdt. 3.23; κ. ἀνάβραστα, ὠπτημένα, Ar. Ra. 553, Pl. 894; κ. ὀρνίθεια Id. Nu. 339; βοῶν Id. Pax 1280; βόεια Pl. R. 338c; δαῖτα παιδείων κρεῶν A. Ag. 1242, 1593; κ. Ἀθηναίοις μερίζειν, νέμειν τῷ δήμῳ, IG 2(2).334.15, 24.

carcass: hence, body, person, τοῦδε τοῦ κρέως (i.e. ἐμοῦ) S. l.c. (satyric): in Com. addresses, like κάρα, ὦ δεξιώτατον κρέας Ar. Eq. 421, cf. 457: prov., ὁ λαγὼς τὸν περὶ τῶν κρεῶν [δρόμον] τρέχει ‘to save oneʼs bacon’, Zen. 4.85, cf. Plu. Suav. 2.1087b; so νεναυμάχηκε τὴν περὶ τῶν κρεῶν Ar. Ra. 191, v. Sch. ( κρεϝας, cf. Skt. krauís ‘raw meat’, Lat. cruor.)
sound of stringed instruments, Epich. 109 (pl.), A.R. 4.909, cf. Poll. 4.63.
AP 6.101 ( Phil.).
Porph. in Cat. 84.15.
containing flesh, AP 6.306.8 (Aristo).
meat-tray, dresser, Il. 9.206:— Ion. κρήϊον Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: Euph. 155.
κρείουσα, ἡ, v. κρείων.

definition: κρειοφάγος, f.l. for κριο-, Nic. Th. 50.

children.definition: Dim. of κρέας, morsel of meat, Alex. 189.
to be better, Hdn. Epim. 69.
dearer than children, ὄμματα dub. in A. Th. 784 (lyr.).

definition: κρείσσων, ον, gen. ονος, as always in Ep. and old Att.; later Att. κρείττων; Ion. κρέσσων Hp. Fract. 3, al., v.l. in Dionys.Trag. (v. infr. II); Dor. κάρρων (q.v.); Cret. κάρτων Leg.Gort. 1.15:— Comp. of κρατύς (v. κράτιστος),

children.definition: stronger, mightier, κ. βασιλεύς, ὅτε χώσεται ἀνδρὶ χέρηϊ Il. 1.80; esp. in battle, κρείσσοσιν ἶφι μάχεσθαι 21.486; Διὸς κ. νόος ἠέ περ ἀνδρῶν 16.688; κεραυνοῦ κρέσσον . . βέλος Pi. I. 8(7).36, cf. Hdt. 7.172, Hp. l.c., etc.; κρείσσων χεῖρας Antipho 4.4.7; τὸ τοῦ κ. συμφέρον Pl. R. 338c, cf. Democr. 267: hence, having the upper hand, superior, ὁππότερος δέ κε νικήσῃ κ. τε γένηται Il. 3.71; κ. ἀρετῇ τε βίῃ τε 23.578: as Law-term, of witnesses, κάρτονανς ἦμεν prevail, Leg.Gort. l.c.

data.quote: κ. βασιλεύς, ὅτε χώσεται ἀνδρὶ χέρηϊ
Διὸς κ. νόος ἠέ περ ἀνδρῶν
ὁππότερος δέ κε νικήσῃ κ. τε γένηται

children.definition: Comp. of ἀγαθός, better, κρέσσονες oneʼs betters, esp. in point of rank, Pi. O. 10(11).39, N. 10.72 (but also, the stronger, more powerful, E. Or. 710, Th. 1.8, etc.); ἐς τοὺς τοκέας καὶ ἐς τοὺς κρέσσονας τεθυμῶσθαι Hdt. 3.52, cf. SIG 685.134 ( Magn. Mae., ii B. C.); οἱ κ. corps of guards at Thebes, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.598e; κρείσσονες θεοί, of the greater gods, as opp. to Oceanus, A. Pr. 902 (lyr.); ὁ κ. Ζεύς Id. Ag. 60 (anap.); οἱ κ. the Higher Powers, Id. Fr. 10, Pl. Sph. 216b, Euthd. 291a, etc.; τὰ κρείσσω, = τὰ θεῖα, E. Ion 973; τὸ κ. the Almighty, Providence, Corp.Herm. 18.11, Jul. Ep. 204, Agath. 1.16, Procop.Gaz. Pan. p.492; τὰ κρείσσονα oneʼs advantages, τὰ ὑπάρχοντα ἡμῖν κρείσσω καταπροδοῦναι Th. 4.10.

data.quote: ἐς τοὺς τοκέας καὶ ἐς τοὺς κρέσσονας τεθυμῶσθαι

children.definition: inf., οὔ τις ἐμεῖο κρείσσων . . δόμεναι no one has a better right to . . , Od. 21.345; οὐκ ἄλλος κ. παραμυθεῖσθαι Pl. Plt. 268b; κρεῖσσόν ἐστι c. inf., ʼtis better to . . , κ. γάρ ἐστιν εἰσάπαξ θανεῖν ἢ . . πάσχειν κακῶς A. Pr. 750, cf. 624, Hdt. 3.52, etc.; τὸ μὴ εἶναι κ. ἢ τὸ ζῆν κακῶς S. Fr. 488, cf. Apollod.Com. 6; also κρείσσων εἰμί c. part., κ. γὰρ ἦσθα μηκέτʼ ὢν ἢ ζῶν τυφλός thou wert better not alive, than living blind, S. OT 1368, cf. Aj. 635 (lyr.); κ. ἦν ὁ ἀγὼν μὴ γεγενημένος Aeschin. 1.192, cf. D.H. 6.9.

data.quote: κ. γάρ ἐστιν εἰσάπαξ θανεῖν ἢ . . πάσχειν κακῶς
τὸ μὴ εἶναι κ. ἢ τὸ ζῆν κακῶς
κ. ἦν ὁ ἀγὼν μὴ γεγενημένος

children.label: II
children.definition: ἤ, too great for, surpassing, beyond, ὕψος κ. ἐκπηδήματος A. Ag. 1376; of evil deeds, κρείσσονʼ ἀγχόνης too bad for hanging, S. OT 1374; κρεῖσσον δεργμάτων too bad to look on, E. Hipp. 1217; θαυμάτων Id. Ba. 667; λέγετι σιγῆς κρεῖσσον ( κρέσσον PSI 9.1093) ἢ σιγὴν ἔχε Dionys.Trag. 6; κρείσσονʼ ἢ λέξαι λόγῳ τολμήματα E. Supp. 844; κ. ἢ λόγοισιν (sc. εἰπεῖν) Id. IT 837; ἀναρχία κ. πυρός Id. Hec. 608; πρᾶγμα ἐλπίδος κ. γεγενημένον worse than one expected, Th. 2.64; κ. λόγου τὸ κάλλος X. Mem. 3.11.1; κ. τῆς ἡμετέρας δυνάμεως Id. Cyr. 7.5.9.

children.label: III
children.definition: having control over, master of, esp. of desires and passions, τῶν ἡδονῶν Democr. 214; τοῦ ἔρωτος X. Cyr. 6.1.34; γαστρὸς καὶ κερδέων ib. 4.2.45; αὑτῶν over themselves, Pl. Phdr. 232a, al.; κ. χρημάτων superior to the influence of money, Th. 2.60, Isoc. 1.19; τῶν συμμάχων κ. X. Ath. 2.1; also, putting oneself above, κ. τοῦ δικαίου Th. 3.84; κρείσσους ὄντες . . τῷ λογισμῷ ἐς τὸ ἀνέλπιστον τοῦ βεβαίου having reasoned themselves into an absolute belief of the hopelessness of certainty, ib. 83; φαύλους καὶ κρείττους τῆς παιδείας, = οὓς παιδευθῆναι ἀδύνατον (just below), Arist. Pol. 1316a9.

children.label: IV
children.definition: better, more excellent, ἁρμονίη ἀφανὴς φανερῆς κ. Heraclit. 54; κ. ἐπʼ ἀρετήν Democr. 181; ὁ κρείττων λόγος (opp. ὁ ἥσσων) Ar. Nu. 113; κατὰ τὸ κ. in a higher sense, opp. κατὰ τὸ χεῖρον, Dam. Pr. 7.

children.label: V
children.definition: Adv. κρεισσόνως Antipho 4.4.6, Iamb. Myst. 7.4; also κρεῖσσον S. OT 176 (lyr.), OGI 90.31 ( Rosetta, ii B. C.). ( κρέσσων from κρέτ-yων, cf. κρέτος; κάρτων and κάρρων from κάρτ-yων, cf. κάρτος; κρείσσων (like μείζων) prob. took ει from ὀλείζων.)
to be diseased, have excrescences, Thphr. HP 4.14.6, CP 5.9.13:— Subst. κρείττ-ωσις, εως, ἡ, ibid.

ruler, lord, master, Ep. word, used in Il. mostly of kings and chiefs, esp. of Agamemnon, 1.130, al. (Com. in parody, of Diomedes, Cratin. 68); of gods, ὕπατε κρειόντων, of Zeus, Il. 8.31, etc.; of Poseidon, εὐρὺ κ. ἐνοσίχθων 11.751; as an honorary epithet, κ. Ἐτεωνεύς, of a squire of Menelaus, Od. 4.22:—so fem. κρείουσα (once in Hom.), κρείουσα γυναικῶν, of a concubine of Priam, Il. 22.48; Ἀντιόπη κ. queen Antiope, Hes. Fr. 110.6, cf. Call. Del. 219; Dor. κρείοισα Theoc. 17.132:—after Hom. in the form κρέων, Pi. P. 8.99, N. 3.10, 7.45; of Zeus, A. Supp. 574 (lyr.):—fem. κρέουσα, B. 3.1: hence pr. n. Κρέων, Κρέουσα. (A participial form ( κρείειν γὰρ τὸ ἄρχειν ἔλεγον οἱ παλαιοί Artem. 2.12): κρείων may be due to metrical lengthening or represent Κρήων.)

data.quote: κρείειν γὰρ τὸ ἄρχειν ἔλεγον οἱ παλαιοί

definition: κρειῶν, Ep. gen. pl. of κρέας.

children.definition: tapestry, Ar. V. 1215.
struck so as to sound, of stringed instruments: generally, played, sung, νόμος A. Ch. 822 (lyr.), cf. S. Fr. 463.
weave, ἴστον Sapph. 90; πέπλους E. El. 542.

strike a stringed instrument with the plectron, μάγαδιν Diog.Ath. 1.10; βάρβιτα D.H. 7.72: generally, play on any instrument, αὐλόν Ar. Av. 682 (lyr.): less freq.c.dat., κρέκειν δόνακι APl. 16.231 (Anyte): c. acc. cogn., πηκτίδων ψαλμοῖς κ. ὕμνον Telest. 5; λωτὸς ᾠδὰν κρέκει Pae.Delph. 12; ἐν κιθάρᾳ νόμον ἔκρεκον AP 9.584.

βοὴν πτεροῖς κ. Ar. Av. 772 (lyr.), cf. AP 7.192 ( Mnasalc.); κίσσα κρέξασα ἁρμονίαν ib. 191 ( Arch.), cf. Hp. ap. Gal. 19.114. (Cf. ONorse hraell (*hrahilaz) ‘weaverʼs sley’, OE. hraegel ‘dress’, ‘garment’, perh. Lett. krekls ‘shirt’.)
rope hung from a hook, Arist. Rh. 1412a14; οὑπὶ τῆς κ. ἀνήρ, of Socrates, Ar. Nu. 218 ( basket or fowl-perch, Sch.).

definition: κρεμάννυμι, Pl. Lg. 830b, etc.; κρεμαννύω, Arist. HA 612a10, Thphr. CP 4.3.3; κρεμάω, Arist. Mir. 831a8, Ael. NA 5.3, etc.; κρεμνάω, Demetr. Eloc. 216, Gp. 4.15.15; κρεμάζω, LXX Jb. 26.7 (v.l. κρεμνῶν): pres. part. κρεμάντες Ath. 1.25d: fut. κρεμάσω [ᾰ] Alc.Com. 8, LXX Ge. 40.19; Att. κρεμῶ, ᾷς, ᾷ, Ar. Pl. 312 (lyr.); Ep. κρεμόω Il. 7.83: aor. 1 ἐκρέμᾰσα Ar. Th. 1028, Ep. and Lyr. κρέμασα Od. 8.67, Pi. P. 4.192; Dor. inf. κραμάσαι IG 42(1).122.3 (Epid.); pf. κεκρέμᾰκα Corn. ND 17:— Med., aor. inf. κρεμάσασθαι Hes. Op. 629, subj. ἐκ-κρεμάσωμαι AP 5.91 ( Rufin.):— Pass., κρέμαμαι, Pi. P. 5.34, Ar. Av. 1387 (also κρεμᾶται Anacreont. 16.17); inf. κρέμασθαι Hp. VM 10, Acut. 30, Antiph. 74.4; subj. κρέμωμαι Hp. Art. 70, Arist. Rh. 1415a13; opt. κρεμαίμην Ar. Ach. 945, V. 298, Nu. 870: impf. ἐκρεμάμην, ω, ατο, Il. 15.21, etc.: fut. κρεμήσομαι in pass. sense, Ar. Ach. 279, V. 808, PCair.Zen. 202.9 (iii B. C.): aor. ἐκρεμάσθην Ar. Th. 1053, etc.: pf. imper. κεκρεμάσθω Apollod. Poliorc. 181.7, v.l. in Archim. Quadr. 13: plpf. κατα-κεκρέμαστο D.S. 18.26. (Cf. κρημνός, Goth. hramjan ‘crucifyʼ):

children.label: I
children.definition: hang up, σειρὴν . . ἐξ οὐρανόθεν κρεμάσαντες Il. 8.19; τόξον ἐκ πίτυος A. Fr. 251; ἀπὸ κάλω κ. σαυτόν Ar. Ra. 122; καὶ κρεμόω προτὶ νηόν will bring them to the temple and hang them up there as an offering, Il. 7.83; κ. τινὰ τῶν ὄρχεων Ar. Pl. 312; κ. [τὰς ὗς] τῶν ὀπισθίων σκελῶν by the hind legs, Arist. HA 632a23; κρεμάσας τὸ νόημα, in allusion to Socrates in his basket, Ar. Nu. 229, cf. Alex. 126.17; κρεμάσαι τὴν ἀσπίδα hang up oneʼs shield, i.e. have done with war, Ar. Ach. 58; τὴν πανοπλίαν Id. Av. 436:—so in Med., πηδάλιον κρεμάσασθαι hang up oneʼs rudder, i.e. give up the sea, Hes. Op. 629.
hang, τινα Arist. Pol. 1311b39, Oec. 1352a11; crucify, Plu. Caes. 2, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be hung up, suspended, ὅτε τʼ ἐκρέμω ( 2 sg. impf.) ὑψόθεν when thou wert hanging, Il. 15.18, cf. 21; μηδʼ ὁ Ταντάλου λίθος τῆσδʼ ὑπὲρ νήσου κρεμάσθω Archil. 53; to be hung up as a votive offering, Pi. P. 5.34, cf. Hdt. 1.34, 66, etc.; τὰ σπλάγχνα οἱ δοκέει κρέμασθαι Hp. VM 10; κάτω κρέμανται S. Fr. 431; κρεμήσεται . . ἐπὶ τοῦ παττάλου Ar. V. 808; κ. ἐφʼ ἵππων X. An. 3.2.19; ἐκ ποδῶν κατωκάρα κ. Ar. Ach. 945; αἱ μέλιτται κ. ἐξ ἀλλήλων Arist. HA 627b13: metaph., ἀμφὶ φρασὶν ἀμπλακίαι κρέμανται Pi. O. 7.25; μῶμος κρέματαί τινι censure hangs over him, ib. 6.74; δόλιος αἰὼν ἐπʼ ἀνδράσι κ. Id. I. 8(7).14; κρέμασθαι ἔκ τινος to be wholly taken up with a thing, Pl. Lg. 831c; ὁ ἐκ τοῦ σώματος κρεμάμενος X. Smp. 8.19.

data.quote: μηδʼ ὁ Ταντάλου λίθος τῆσδʼ ὑπὲρ νήσου κρεμάσθω

children.definition: to be hanged, of persons, E. Hipp. 1252, Aristopho 9.10, PCair.Zen. l.c.
to be in suspense, ἵνα μὴ κρέμηται ἡ διάνοια Arist. Rh. 1415a13; κ. [ὁλόγος] Gal. 18(2).754.
Arat. 65 (ubi v. Sch.).
beetling, πέτρα A. Supp. 795 (lyr.).
suspendium, Gloss.
hanging up, Hp. Art. 74, Orib. 8.6.16.

definition: κρέμασμα, ατος, τό, = sq., Sch.rec. A. Pr. 157.

children.definition: suspension, of a broken rib, unsupported by reason of the emptiness of the stomach, Hp. Art. 49: generally, ib. 76, Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.9.15.
chandelier, Anon. in Rh. 211.2.
one must hang, Sor. 1.51, Gp. 16.1.11.

suspender: οἱ κρεμαστῆρες the muscle by which the testicles are suspended, Gal. 4.635, 18(2).998, Poll. 2.173; = ὄρχεις, PLips. 42.19 (iv A. D.), Hippiatr. 30; but, vasa deferentia, Ruf. Onom. 197, Sat.Gon. 10, Paul.Aeg. 6.61; a supposed muscle suspending the ovaries, Sor. 1.12.
stalk by which a grape-cluster hangs, Gp. 5.2.11, 5.17.5.

hung, suspended, γυνή S. OT 1263; κ. αὐχένος hung by the neck, Id. Ant. 1221: c. gen., hung from or on a thing, παραστάδος κρεμαστὰ τεύχη E. Andr. 1122; κ. ἀρτάνη, i.e. a halter, S. OT 1266; βρόχοι κ. E. Hipp. 779; σκεύη κ. the rigging of ships, opp. ξύλινα σκ., X. Oec. 8.12; τὰ κ. ἱστία Hermipp. 63.12; κλινίδιον κ. hammock, Plu. Per. 27; κ. ποτιστρέα PTeb. 527 (ii A. D.); κ. σταφυλή, i. e. dried grapes, Alex.Trall. 8.1; οἱ κ. κῆποι hanging gardens, Plu. Alex. fort. 2.342b; κ. παράδεισος Beros. ap. J. AJ 10.11.1; κρεμαστά, τά, fortresses, LXX Jd. 6.2.

definition: κρεμάστρα, ἡ, Hellen. for κρεμάθρα ( Moer. p.242 P.), Eust. 1625.17, v.l. in Arist. Rh. 1412a14.

children.definition: stalk by which a flower hangs, Thphr. HP 3.16.4.
larder, Gloss.
castanets, Carm.Pop. 3.
mark time with castanets, Hermipp. 31 (- ίζουσι codd. Ath.), cf. Hsch.
rattling with castanets, to give the time in dancing, h.Ap. 162 ( v.l. - αστής, οῦ, ὁ).
bobbins, reels, Hsch.

definition: κρέμυς, υος, ἡ, = χρέμυς, Arist. Fr. 294.

children.definition: corn-crake, Rallus crex, or ruff, Machetes pugnax, τούτους (sc. λίθους) ἐτύκιζον αἱ κρέκες τοῖς ῥύγχεσιν Ar. Av. 1138, cf. Arist. PA 695a22, Ael. NA 4.5; sacred to Athena, Porph. Abst. 3.5; [ ἡ ἶβις] μέγαθος ὅσον κ. Hdt. 2.76; a name of ill omen to the newly-married, Euph. 4: hence δισάρπαγος κρέξ, of Helen, Lyc. 513.
noisy braggart, Eup. 423.

children.label: II
children.definition: hair, Hsch., Suid.: acc. κρέκαν Eust. 1528.18.

definition: κρεο-, representing stem of κρέας in Compds., freq. written κρεω- in codd.

children.definition: eat flesh, D.S. 24.1 ( κρεω-).
fed on flesh, A. Supp. 287 (Abresch for κρεόβροτος).
distribution of meat, Demetr.Sceps. ap. Ath. 10.425c, Plu. QConv. 2.643a.
distribute meat, Zonar.
distributor of meat, carver at a public meal, Plu. Lys. 23, Ages. 8, Poll. 6.34, 7.25: κρεω-, Phld. Vit. p.26 J.:—fem. κρεοδαῖτις ἀρχή Poll. 6.34.
flaying-knife, Poll. 7.25 ( κρεωδ- codd.).
Zonar., v.l. in Plu. Demetr. 11:
CIG 4485 ( Palmyra), Suid.
Il. 9.206, Hsch. s.v. κρήϊον, EM 536.57 ( κρεω-).
butcher, Gloss. ( κρεω- cod.).
one who has charge of the larder, title of priest, Supp.Epigr. 4.357 ( Panamara).
larder, Hsch. s.v. κρήϊνον.
a mess of meat hashed with fat and blood, Ath. 9.384d.
cut up like meat: hence, hack in pieces, κ. δυστήνων μέλη A. Pers. 463; μέλη ξένων E. Cyc. 359 (lyr.).
cutter up of flesh, D.H. 12.2.8 (pl.), Gloss.
butcher, Gloss.
deal in butcherʼs meat, Poll. 6.33, 7.25.
seller of meat, butcher, Macho ap. Ath. 13.580c, cf. AP 11.212 ( Lucill.), Thphr. Char. 9.4 ( κρεω-).
of or for a butcher, τράπεζα Plu. QConv. 2.643a:—fem. κρεό-πωλις ἀγορά the meat market, Hsch. s.v. κάπηλα.
butcherʼs shop, D.S. 12.24, Str. 17.2.4, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.277e, Poll. 7.25.
live on meat, Poll. 6.33.
butcherʼs steelyard, Ar. Fr. 799.
cut up like a butcher, J. AJ 13.12.6: hence, butcher, mangle, Luc. Syr.D. 55, D.L. 9.108:— Pass., Ph. 2.544, D.C. 75.7.
like a butcher, in pieces, τοὺς ἄνδρας κ. διασπᾶν Hdt. 3.13 ( Ion. κρεοργ-).
cutting up, butchering, Πέλοπος Luc. Salt. 54.
of or for a butcher or his trade, Gloss.
working, i.e. cutting up, meat: κρεουργὸν ἦμαρ a day of slaughter and feasting, A. Ag. 1592.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. κ., ὁ, butcher or carver, Poll. 7.25.
eat flesh, Hp. Salubr. 7, Plb. 2.17.10 ( v.l. κρεα-), Str. 16.4.17, Ph. 2.398 (vv.ll. κρεω-, κρεη-):— Pass., κάμηλοι κρεοφαγούμεναι D.S. 2.54.
eating of flesh, Hp. Acut. 37, D.S. 3.31, Ph. 2.235 (vv.ll. κρεω-, κρεη-), Porph. Abst. 1.15, al.; κ. τῶν θηρίων Str. 16.4.9; χρῆσθαι κρεοφαγίᾳ Plu. Sanit. 2.132a ( κρεω-).
eating flesh, carnivorous, Hdt. 4.186, Arist. PA 693a3, etc.; cf. κρεηφάγος.

definition: κρετέω, κρέτος, Aeol. for κρατέω, κράτος (qq.v.).

children.definition: fleshy, Arist. HA 491b25, 583b10; ὀσμὴ κ. odour of flesh, Thphr. Fr. 167; κ. τροφή meat diet, Gal. 10.849; τὰ κ. Id. 6.600.
larder, Gloss. (dub.).

definition: κρήγυος, ον, Dor. κράγῠος [ᾱ] Cerc. 7.14, Lysis Ep. 3:—

children.definition: good, useful or agreeable, once in Hom., οὐ πώ ποτέ μοι τὸ κ. εἶπας Il. 1.106; ἄλλο μὲν οὐδὲν κ. AP 7.284 ( Asclep.); οὐδὲ γουνάτων πόνος κρήγυον a good symptom, Hp. Coac. 31; τό τοι μέγα κρήγυον ἔσται Nic. Th. 935; ποτὶ οὐδὲν κράγυον σχολάζοντες Lysis l.c. Adv. κρηγύως ἐπαιδεύθην Call. Iamb. 1.196; νομίμως καὶ κ. honourably, Perict. ap. Stob. 4.28.19.

data.quote: οὐ πώ ποτέ μοι τὸ κ. εἶπας

children.definition: Hom., true, real, εἴπατέ μοι τὸ κ. Theoc. 20.19, cf. Hp. Ep. 17, AP 7.648 ( Leon.), Anon. ap. Stob. 3.28.21: as Adv., in good earnest, πορθεῖς με τὸ κ. AP 5.57 ( Arch.).

good, serviceable, οὐκ ἐπίστανται, οὐδὲ κ. διδάσκαλοί εἰσι Pl. Alc. 1.111e; εἰ δʼ ἐσσί κ. τε καὶ παρὰ χρηστῶν Theoc. Ep. 19; παρʼ οἴνῳ κ. AP 7.355 ( Damag.); esp. of a woman, honest, Herod. 4.46, 6.39.

data.quote: οὐκ ἐπίστανται, οὐδὲ κ. διδάσκαλοί εἰσι
εἰ δʼ ἐσσί κ. τε καὶ παρὰ χρηστῶν

children.definition: wearing the κρήδεμνον, Aus. Ep. 8.13.

definition: κρήδεμνον, Dor. κρᾱδ-, τό, ( κράς, δέω)

children.definition: womanʼs head-dress or veil, a kind of mantilla, κ. ὅ ῥά οἱ (sc. Ἀνδρομάχῃ) δῶκε χρυσέη Ἀφροδίτη Il. 22.470; κρηδέμνῳ δʼ ἐφύπερθε καλύψατο δῖα θεάων 14.184: pl., [ Πηνελόπεια] ἄντα παρειάων σχομένη λιπαρὰ κ. Od. 1.334; δμῳαί τε καὶ αὐτή, . . ἀπὸ κ. βαλοῦσαι 6.100, cf. E. Ph. 1490 (lyr.).

data.quote: κρηδέμνῳ δʼ ἐφύπερθε καλύψατο δῖα θεάων
Πηνελόπεια] ἄντα παρειάων σχομένη λιπαρὰ κ.
δμῳαί τε καὶ αὐτή, . . ἀπὸ κ. βαλοῦσαι

children.label: II
children.definition: battlements which crown a cityʼs walls, Τροίης ἱερὰ κ. Il. 16.100, cf. Od. 13.388, h.Cer. 151, B. Fr. 16.7; πέτρινα κ. E. Tr. 508: sg., Θήβης κρήδεμνον Hes. Sc. 105.
cover, lid of a wine-jar, Od. 3.392.
κρηθεῖν· κακολογεῖν, Id. κρῆθεν, Adv., v. κράς II.

samphire, Crithmum maritimum, Hp. Nat.Mul. 2, al., Call. Fr. 64, Lyc. 238 (pl., accented κρηθμοῖσι), Nic. Th. 909. (Neut. in Dsc. 2.129, Ruf. Ren.Ves. 1.18 (pl.); masc. κρῆθμος, ὁ, Eust. 582.16, crethmus Plin. HN 26.158; κρίθμος (sic), Hdn.Gr. 1.167.)
larder, Hsch. (s.v.l.).
bride-cake, Philet. ap. Ath. 14.645d: pl., = ζῴδια (i.e. cakes in shape of animals), Hsch.
D.L. 6.50, PHolm. 8.11 ( κριμ-).
speak rugged words, Tz.ad Hes. Op. p.10 G.

hang, ἄγκυραν ποτὶ . . ναῒ κρημνάντων Pi. P. 4.25, cf. Arist. Mir. 831a8 (v.l.); κρήμνη (imper.) σεαυτὴν ἐκ . . ἀντηρίδος E. Fr. 1111 ( = Eup. 455); crucify, τούσδε ἐκρήμνη ( impf.) App. Mith. 97:— Pass., κρήμναμαι hang, be suspended, E. El. 1217 (lyr., κριμν-), App. BC 1.71; float in air, ὕπερθʼ ὀμμάτων κρημναμενᾶν νεφελᾶν A. Th. 229 (lyr.).
hurl down headlong, κατὰ τοῦ τείχους LXX 2 Ma. 6.10: metaph., ἐπὶ ἀτάκτους ἡδονὰς ἑαυτοὺς κ. Plu. Lib.educ. 2.5b:— Pass., J. BJ 2.3.3, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).156.
hurling down headlong, Sch. Th. 7.45.

definition: κρημνισμός, ὁ, = foreg., Ptol. Tetr. 151, Doroth. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 5(3).84 (pl.).

children.definition: haunt precipices, Ctes. ap. Lyd. Mens. 4.14, Str. 15.1.56, Ph. 2.444, S.E. M. 11.126, Longus 3.28.
climber of steeps, Πάν AP 9.142, cf. Polyaen. 4.3.29.
rope-dancer, Hsch.
written in rugged style, uncouth, ῥήματα Tz. ad Hes. Op. p.9 G.
boast, indulge in ‘tall talk’, Phot., Suid.
speaking crags, i.e. using big, rugged words, of Aeschylus, Ar. Nu. 1367.

Eus. Mynd.63:— overhanging bank, in Hom. (only Il.) of the bank of a river, edge of a trench, 12.54, 21.175, 234, 244, cf. Pi. O. 3.22; κ. θαλάσσας Id. Fr. 201; κ. μαλακοί Arist. HA 615b31; later, beetling cliff, crag, ἀπὸ τοῦ κ. ὠθέειν Hdt. 4.103; ἀναθεῖναι ἐπὶ κρημνόν τινʼ Ar. Pl. 69; κατὰ τῶν κ. ἅλλεσθαι down from the cliffs of Epipolae, Th. 7.45; κατὰ κ. ῥιφέντες Pl. Lg. 944a; οἱ K., the Screes, on the Sea of Azof, Hdt. 4.20, 110.
edges of an ulcer, Hp. Loc.Hom. 29.
labia pudendi, ib. 47, Poll. 2.174, Ruf. Onom. 112.
to be afraid of precipices, Hp. Ep. 19 ( Hermes 53.70).
precipitous, Th. 7.84, Dsc. 4.144, Onos. 10.17, etc.; τὸ κ. τῆς ὄχθης Plu. Tim. 31: Sup., Hdn. 6.5.5.
steep mountain-ridge, Hdn. Epim. 232.
οἰνοχόαι καὶ κρημοφόροι IG 2(2).1425.358.

definition: κρηνάγγη ἀρχὴ ἐπὶ τῆς ἐπιμελείας ὕδατος, Hsch.

children.definition: of, from a spring or fountain, Νύμφαι κρηναῖαι, = Κρηνιάδες, Od. 17.240; κ. ὕδωρ spring water, Hdt. 4.181; ποτόν S. Tr. 14, Ph. 21; νασμοί E. Hipp. 225 (anap.); γάνος, i.e. the water of Dirce, A. Pers. 483; λιβάδες AP 9.549 ( Antiphil.); K. πύλαι the gate of Dirce (v. Sch.), E. Ph. 1123.

definition: κρήνη, Dor. κράνα IG 42(1).121.6 (Epid.), etc.; Aeol. κράννα ib. 12(2).103 (Mytil.): ἡ:—

children.definition: well, spring, fountain, μελάνυδρος, καλλιρέεθρος, Il. 16.3, Od. 10.107, cf. Pi. P. 1.39, al., Pl. Phd. 112c, etc.; opp. φρέαρ (q.v.), Hdt. 4.120, Th. 2.48; ἐμπλησαμένη τὴν ὑδρίαν . . ἀπὸ κρήνης Ar. Lys. 328; κ. οἴνου E. Ba. 707; ὀμνύω . . κράνας καὶ ποταμούς SIG 527.34 ( Dreros, iii B. C.): poet. in pl., for water, S. OC 686, Ant. 844 (both lyr.); κρηνῶν ἐπιμελητής, title of official at Athens, IG 2(2).338.11, Arist. Ath. 43.1, cf. Pl. Lg. 758e, Arist. Pol. 1321b26, OGI 483.159 (Pergam.).
from a well or spring, AP 15.25.18 ( Besant.).
ἀρχή Orac. ap. Dam. Pr. 344.
to a well or spring, Od. 20.154.
κρηναῖος, Νύμφαι Κρηνιάδες A. Fr. 168 (hex.).

definition: κρηνίδιον, τό, Dim. of κρήνη, Arist. Mir. 841b9, Antig. Mir. 142, etc.
κρηνίον, τό, = foreg., Inscr.Délos 290.75 (iii B. C.), Str. 3.4.17, IGRom. 4.1657 ( Almura).

children.definition: E. Hipp. 208 (anap.), Call. Fr.anon. 98, Theoc. 1.22 ( Dor. κρᾱν-), D.H. 1.32.

children.label: II
children.definition: Κρηνῖδες, αἱ, ancient name for Philippi in Macedonia, Str. 7 Fr. 34, App. BC 4.105; τὰ ἐγ Κρηνῖσιν, as local place-name, IG 12(5).544 B 2.47 ( Ceos).
growing near a spring, βοτάναι Hp. Ep. 16.
ruling over springs, of Poseidon, Corn. ND 22.
office of the κρηνοφύλαξ, Poll. 8.113.
warden of the springs, IG 11(2).159 A 61, 161 A 85 ( Delos, iii B. C.); at Athens, official in charge of the κλεψύδρα, Poll. 8.113, Phot.
which stood over the spring that supplied the κλεψύδρα, Poll. l.c., Phot.
basement of a house, Lys. Fr. 185 S.:—also κρηπῑδ-ειον, IG 14.915 ( Ostia).
belonging to a substructure or foundation, [ λίθοι] IG 1(2).313.90, cf. Rev.Phil. 50.67 ( Didyma, ii B. C.).
Dim. of κρηπίς, kerb, Rev.Phil. 43.213, Cinquantenaire de lʼécole des hautes études p.89 ( Didyma, ii B. C., pl.).
boot-maker, Ath. 13.568e.

definition: κρηπιδουργός, οῦ, ὁ, = foreg., Din. Fr. 89.20.

children.definition: furnish with boots:— Pass., put on oneʼs boots, Anon. ap. Suid.
furnish with a quay, D.C. 60.11; furnish with a foundation, found, Id. 51.1:— Pass., to be supported, ἐπὶ θατέρου σκέλους Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.233b.
foundation, Inscr.Magn. 293, JHS 5.127 ( Termessus), D.S. 13.82, Aq. Ez. 43.14.
manʼs high boot (cf. AB 273), half-boot, Hegem. Parod. 4, X. Eq. 12.10, Thphr. Char. 2.7 (dub.): distd.from ὑποδήματα, Aristocl.Hist. 8; κ. λευκαί, a mark of effeminacy, Timae. 82.

children.label: b
children.definition: κρηπῖδες soldiers’ boots, i.e. soldiers themselves, Theoc. 15.6.
shoe-shaped cake, Poll. 6.77.

children.label: II
children.definition: groundwork, foundation, basement of a building or altar, Hdt. 1.93, S. Tr. 993 (anap.), E. Ion 38 (pl.), HF 985, X. An. 3.4.7, IG 1(2).372.67; κ. καὶ στυλοβάτας ib. 42(1).102.7 (Epid.); τύμβου ʼπὶ κρηπῖδʼ E. Hel. 547: metaph., βάλλεσθαι κρηπῖδα σοφῶν ἐπέων Pi. P. 4.138; κ. ἀοιδᾶν βαλέσθαι ib. 7.3; ἐβάλοντο φαεννὰν κρηπῖδʼ ἐλευθερίας Id. Fr. 77; κ. γένους E. HF 1261; ἡ ἐγκράτεια ἀρετῆς κ. X. Mem. 1.5.4, cf. Onos. 4.4: οὐδέπω κακῶν κ. ὕπεστιν we have not yet got to the bottom of misery, A. Pers. 815; κ. θαλάσσης Opp. H. 3.453, 5.48; κ. καὶ ἕδρα νόσου foundation and seat of disease, Max.Tyr. 13.7.

walled edge of a river or canal, quay, Hdt. 1.185, 2.170, Plb. 5.37.8, PTeb. 382.9 (i B. C.); abutment of a bridge, Epigr.Gr. 1078.3 ( Adana); tiers of seats in a theatre, IG ΙΙ(2).203 A 95 ( Delos, iii B. C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: ox-tongue, Helminthia echioides, Thphr. HP 7.8.3, Plin. HN 21.99.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Sor. Fasc. 59.

definition: Κρής, ὁ, gen. Κρητός, mostly in pl. Κρῆτες, ῶν,

children.definition: Cretan, Il. 2.645, etc.: prov., ὁ Κρὴς τὸν πόντον (sc. ἀγνοεῖ), of those who feign ignorance, Alcm. 115, cf. Str. 10.4.17:—fem. Κρῆσσα, ης, Sapph. 54: in pl., title of play by Aeschylus: as Adj., Cretan, Κρῆτα τρόπον Simon. 31; Κρὴς ταῦρος Apollod. 2.5.7; μητρὸς . . Κρήσσης S. Aj. 1295:—regul. Adj. Κρήσιος, α, ον, Id. Tr. 119, E. Hipp. 372 (both lyr.), Limen. 39, etc.:—more freq. Κρητικός, ή, όν (q.v.).

definition: κρῆς, Dor. for κρέας, Sophr. 25, Ar. Ach. 795, Theoc. 1.6.
κρησέρα, ἡ, Ion. κρησέρη, Elean κραἅρα (q. v.),

children.definition: flour-sieve, bolting-sieve, Hp. Steril. 222 (but expld. as a straining-cloth by Erot.), Ar. Ec. 991, Gal. Nat.Fac. 2.3, Aret. CA 1.4, Poll. 6.74:— Dim. κρησέρ-ιον, τό, Id. 10.114, Zonar.

children.label: II
children.definition: fine net for fishing, Phot.
of sifted flour, Diph. 26.

definition: κρησίαι καλλίονες, Hsch. Κρήσιος, α, ον, v. Κρής.
κρησίπαιδα (fort. - πεδα) · ἐν Σαμιακῇ θυσίᾳ . . μέρη ἱερείων, Hsch. Κρῆσσα, v. Κρής.

children.definition: place of refuge, retreat, Hdt. 5.124, al., D.H. 4.15, Luc. Eun. 10, al. (Etym. dub.; expld. by EM 538.1 as refuge from the Cretan, i.e. Minos.)

definition: κρησφύγιον [ ῠ], τό, = foreg., Steph. in Rh. 253.2.

Κρηταιεύς, Att. Κρηταεύς IG 2(2).687.25: ὁ:— Cretan, A.R. 1.1129, Plb. 6.46.3, GDI 5160 ( Mylasa), AP 7.448 ( Leon.):—fem. Κρητ-αιίς, ίδος, ib. 6.299 ( Phan.):—also Κρηταῖος, α, ον, A.R. 2.1232, AP 14.129.

children.definition: Dim. of Lat. creta, piece of chalk, Gp. 2.42.2 ( κριτ-), Aët. 2.10, Charis. p.553 K., Hippiatr. 49.
president of the κοινόν of Crete, CIG 2744 ( Aphrodisias).
Crete, Il. 2.649, etc.: pl., Κρητάων εὐρειάων Od. 14.199, 16.62: Κρήτηθεν or Κρήτηθε, from Crete, Il. 3.233, Q.S. 5.350, Porph. Abst. 2.21: Κρήτηνδε to Crete, Od. 19.186.
= Lat. creta, chalk, PMag.Lond. 121.858:—hence prob. κρητηρία, ἡ, ib. 169; cf. κρητάριον.

definition: κρητήρ, ῆρος, ὁ, Ion. and Ep. for κρατήρ (q.v.). κρητηρίζω, v. κρατηρίζω.

children.definition: speak like a Cretan, D.Chr. [11.23].

children.label: II
children.definition: play the Cretan, i.e. lie, πρὸς Κρῆτας or Κρῆτα K. ‘diamond cut diamond’, Plb. 8.18.5, Plu. Aem. 23, Lys. 20.
Cretan, A. Ch. 616 (lyr.), Ar. Ra. 849, etc.; τὸ K. πέλαγος Th. 4.53, etc. Adv. - κῶς in Cretan fashion, Ar. Ec. 1165.

children.label: II
children.definition: Κρητικόν (sc. ἱμάτιον), τό, short garment, used at sacred rites, Id. Th. 730, Eup. 311.

Κρητικός (sc. ποῦς), ὁ, a metrical foot [_ ⏑ _], = ἀμφίμακρος, Heph. 3.2, cf. A.D. Pron. 50.16; so ἔγειρε . . , Μοῦσα, K. μέλος Cratin. 222; τὸ K. (sc. μέτρον) Heph. 13.1; K. ῥυθμός, ῥυθμοί, D.H. Comp. 25, Str. 10.4.16.
Cretan behaviour, i.e. lying, Plu. Aem. 26.
born in Crete, epith. of Zeus, GDI 5075.73 ( Latos).
barley, only as nom. and acc., κρῖ λευκόν Il. 8.564. Od. 4.41, al.
armoured cavalryman, Zeitschr. Deutsch.Pal.Vereins 44.93 ( Jerusalem, iv/v A. D.), Stud.Pal. 20.135.4 (vi A. D.), Lyd. Mag. 1.46; cf. Lat. clibanarius, Cod. Theod. 14.17.9, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: baker, dub. in CIL 4.677, Stud.Pal. 20.131.4 (vi A. D.).
bakery, BGU 1117.24 ( i B. C., κλ-).
baker, POxy. 1142.10 ( iii A. D., κλ-), Man. 1.80 ( κλ-).
a cake, Alcm. 20 (- νωτος codd. Ath.), cf. Hsch.
belonging to a bakery, σκεύη BGU 1117.11 ( i B. C., κλ-).
baking-oven, PLond. 5.1733.23 (vi A. D.).
for baking, ἐργαστήριον BGU 1117.8 ( i B. C., κλ-), cf. PTeb. 351.6 (ii A. D.).
baked in a pan ( κρίβανος), of bread, Ar. Fr. 125, Epich. 52, Amips. 5, Sophr. 27 (also κλ- Id. 28), Gal. 6.489, etc.; ὁ κ. (sc. ἄρτος) loaf so baked, Ar. Ach. 1123: hence, comically, βοῦς κ. ib. 87.
shaped like a κρίβανος, Dsc. 1.72.4; ἔσοπτρον Anthem.p.151 W.

definition: κρίβανος, ὁ, Att. for κλίβανος (which is called Dor. in EM 538.19, cf. Epich. 143, and is the usu. form in Pap., PPetr. 3p.328 (iii B. C.), etc.),

children.definition: covered earthen vessel, wider at bottom than at top, wherein bread was baked by putting hot embers round it, Hdt. 2.92 (in form κλιβ-), A. Fr. 309, Ar. Ach. 86, V. 1153, al., Antiph. 176.5; οὕτως εἰμὶ ὡς εἰς κρίβανον POxy. 1842.7 (vi A. D.); potterʼs oven, PCair.Zen. 271.9 ( iii B. C., κλ-).
funnel-shaped vessel, used for drawing water, Str. 16.2.13 ( κλ-).

children.label: II
children.definition: underground channel or vaulted passage, in irrigation works, Sammelb. 7188.17 ( ii B. C., κλ-).
hollow, cavern in a rock, Ael. NA 2.22.
baked in a κρίβανος, hence κριβανωτός (sc. ἄρτος), ὁ, Alcm. 20 (codd. Ath.), Ar. Pl. 765; κ. ζῷα Eust. 1286.19.
gnashing of teeth, Sch. Ar. Av. 1520:—also κριγμός, Zonar.

children.label: II
children.definition: shrieking, νεκρῶν Hippon. 54.

children.label: III
children.definition: κριγή· ἡ γλαύξ, Hsch.
Stratt. 47.7.

definition: κρίδιον [ ῑ], τό, contr. from κριΐδιον, Dim. of κριός, Hsch. κρίες· ἡ χελιδών, Id. κρίζαος· ψώρα, κρίζα, Id. κριζόν· ἐπίλεκτον, διάφορον, Id.
κρίζω, aor. 1 ἔκριξα Ael. NA 5.50, Hsch.: aor. 2 and pf. (v. infr.):—

children.definition: creak, κρίκε ζυγόν Il. 16.470.

children.label: II
children.definition: screech, ὥσπερ Ἰλλυριοὶ κεκριγότες Ar. Av. 1521; χαμαιτύπη κρίζει τις Men. 879; in Boeot., laugh, v. κριδδέμεν. (Onomatop.)
like a ram, Ar. Lys. 309.

definition: κρίθα κρίθινον, καὶ ἵππου ἀρρώστημα, Hsch.

children.definition: barley-pottage, Hom. Epigr. 15.7.
barley-meal, Aët. 12.71.
Polyaen. 4.3.32.
like barley: κ. πυρός a branching cereal, perh. millet, Thphr. HP 8.2.3.

definition: κριθάριον, τό, Dim. of κριθή, BGU 33.11 (pl., ii/iii A. D.), PTeb. 420.21 (iii A. D.), Thom.Mag. p.202R.

children.definition: mixture of barley and chaff, PFlor. 377.14 (vi A.D.).
to be barley-fed, wax wanton, κριθῶν πῶλος A. Ag. 1641; κριθώσης ὄνου S. Fr. 876.

barleycorns, barley (cf. κρῖ), the meal being ἄλφιτα: πυρῶν ἢ κριθῶν Il. 11.69, cf. Od. 9.110, 19.112, Ar. Eq. 1101; κριθᾶν μέδιμμνον IG 42(1).40.7 (Epid.); τὰς οὐλοχύτας φέρε δεῦρο—τοῦτο δʼ ἐστὶ τί;—κριθαί Strato Com. 1.35; οἶνος ἐκ κριθέων πεποιημένος a kind of beer, Hdt. 2.77; ἐκ κριθῶν μέθυ A. Supp. 953, cf. Arist. Fr. 106; κριθαὶ πεφρυγμέναι, = κάχρυς, Th. 6.22, cf. Moer. p.213 P.: pl., also of species of barley, Thphr. HP 8.1.1: sg., PGrenf. 2.29.9 (ii B. C.); κ. Ἰνδική millet, Sorghum halepense, Thphr. HP 8.4.2.

data.quote: τὰς οὐλοχύτας φέρε δεῦρο—τοῦτο δʼ ἐστὶ τί;—κριθαί

children.label: II
children.definition: pustule on the eyelid, stye, Hp. Epid. 2.2.5, Gal. 12.742.

children.label: III
children.definition: barley-corn, the smallest weight, Thphr. Lap. 46.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Ar. Pax 965. (The connexion with Lat. hordeum, OHG. gersta is doubtful.)
κἠπὶ τὸν κριθθὸν κοῖλον GDI 5016.11 ( Gortyn).
surfeit caused by over-feeding with barley, X. Eq. 4.2, Hippiatr. 8, al.
suffer from κριθίασις, Arist. HA 604b8.

children.label: II
children.definition: wax wanton, Cleanth.Stoic. 1.132, Cerc. 17.36, Babr. 62.2, cf. Poll. 7.24.
Dim. of κριθή, decoction of barley, Hp. Nat.Mul. 53 (s. v.l.).
a little barley, Posidon. 36 J., Luc. Asin. 3, 47.
feed with barley, Aesop. 178, Babr. 76.2.
consisting in barley, φόρος BGU 922.7 (iii A. D.).

made of or from barley, κόλλιξ, ἄρτος, Hippon. 35, Luc. Macr. 5; ἄχυρον, ἄλευρον, Thphr. HP 8.4.1, PEleph. 5.25 (iii B. C.), Plu. Pyth. 2.397a; τὸ κ. ποτόν Hp. Acut. 64; κ. ὕδωρ ib.( Sp.) 30; κ. οἶνος beer, Plb. 34.9.15; πόμα Plu. Amat. 2.752b: metaph., κ. Δημοσθένης, ‘gingerbread Demosthenes’, nickname of Dinarchus, Hermog. Id. 2.11.

definition: κριθίον, τό, Dim. of κριθή, Luc. Asin. 17, Longus 3.30.

children.definition: gathering barley: among the Opuntii, a magistrate who kept the barley for sacrifices, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.292c: —hence κρῑθο-λογία, ἡ, Cod.Theod. 14.26.1.
divination by barley, Oenom. ap. Eus. PE 5.25.
one who divined by barley, Suid. s.v. προφητεία.
sending of barley, Eratosth. ap. Hsch. s.v. Ῥοίκου κ.
wheat mixed with barley, PPetr. 3p.206, al. (iii B. C.), PSI 5.532.6 (iii B. C.), PFay. 101 iii 4 (i B. C.): acc. pl. - πυρα PCair.Zen. 498 (iii B. C.).
dealer in barley, Hippiatr. 1.
barley-eating, Ar. Av. 231.
barley-diet, a punishment in the Roman army, Plb. 6.38.4.
living on barley, ὄρνιθες D.C. Fr. 43.33, cf. Sch. Ar. Av. 232.
bearing barley, Thphr. HP 8.8.2, Str. 8.6.16.
office of controller of export of barley, Hsch.
like barley, made of it, κριθώδεις πτισάναι, = ὅλη πτισάνη, opp. χυλός, Hp. Acut. 40.
barley-wasting, of horses that will not fatten, Phryn. PS p.79 B.

definition: κρίθων ( κρίθον cod.): ἐπώνυμον ἀνδροκιδάλου, Hsch. κρίκα· κρίκον, Id. κρικαδιᾶν· τὸ ἐναλλάξαι τοὺς δακτύλους ὥσπερ κρίκους ( [.]ρυβούς cod.), Id., cf. κρικαδίαν (acc. sg.), Sch. Il. 23.34. κρίκε, v. κρίζω.

children.definition: hoop of a ring, Alex.Trall. 8.2.
circulus, Gloss.
trundling of hoops, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.26.1.

definition: κρίκιον, τό, Dim. of κρίκος, Inscr.Délos 380.100 (ii B. C.), POxy. 1300.5 (v A. D.).

children.definition: ring-shaped, annular, Gal. 14.715, Placit. 1.3.18.
to be secured by a ring, κεκρίκωνται τὸ χεῖλος χαλκῷ κρίκῳ they have a brass ring through the lip, Str. 17.2.3; to be infibulated, Heliod. ap. Orib. 50.11.1.
to be formed into a ring, Heracl. ap. Orib. 48.13.1.

definition: κρίκος [ ῐ], ὁ, Homeric form of κίρκος,

children.definition: ring, on a horseʼs breastband, to fasten it to the peg ( ἕστωρ) at the end of the carriage-pole, Il. 24.272.
eyelet-hole in sails, through which the reefingropes were drawn, Hdt. 2.36, cf. Poll. 1.94, PLond. 3.1164 ( h) 8 (iii A. D.).
curtain-ring, Thphr. HP 4.2.7, J. AJ 3.6.2.
finger-ring, Arist. Pol. 1324b14; part of a finger-ring, Inscr.Délos 461 Ba 6, al. (ii B. C.).
nose-ring, S.E. P. 3.203.
armlet, Plu. Dem. 30.
link in a chain, Id. Aet.Gr. 2.304b, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.67, Iamb. Comm.Math. 7; ἐκ κρίκου λεπτοῦ πεποιημένα ὑφάσματα chain armour, Jul. Or. 37d.
hoop, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.26.2.
ring of a spanner, Hero Bel. 101.13; of a ring-bolt, Apollod. Poliorc. 166.15; of an armillary sphere, Procl. Hyp. 6.2 (pl.).
ring, circle, Eust. 726.16.
infibulation, Heliod. ap. Orib. 50.11.1.
ringed, made of rings, Caryst. 7; θώραξ Eust. 528.24; κ. σφαῖρα armillary sphere, Gem. 16.10 (pl.), Gell. 3.10.3, Ptol. Geog. 7.6, Alm. 1.6 (pl.); ἀστρολάβος Sch. Ptol. 90.
decision, judgement, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.58, Plb. 23.1.12, LXX Ps. 118(119).7, al., Ep.Rom. 11.33, Arr. Epict. 2.15.8; περί τινος M.Ant. 8.47; verdict on a literary work, Phld. Po. 5.23.
decree, resolution, δήμου D.H. 4.12; ἱερομνημόνων BCH 27.107, cf. IGRom. 3.58,66 ( Prusias).

legal decision, PPetr. 3p.56 (iii B. C.), SIG 826 E ii 29 ( Delph., ii B. C.); decision of arbitrators, ib. 421.44 ( Thermum, iii B. C.); esp. sentence, condemnation, LXX De. 21.22, al., Ev.Marc. 12.40, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: matter for judgement, question, οὐκ εὔκριτον τὸ κρῖμα A. Supp. 397.
law-suit, LXX Ex. 18.22, 1 Ep.Cor. 6.7.

children.label: III
children.definition: judging, judgement, Ev.Jo. 9.39, Act.Ap. 24.25, etc. [ ῖ in A. l.c. (nisi leg. κρεῖμα): ῐ in post-classical poetry; freq. written κρίμα in codd.]
made of κρίμνον, coarse bread, Archestr. Fr. 4.13 ( κριμματίαν codd.), Iatrocl. ap. Ath. 14.646a.
coarse barley meal, Hp. ap. Gal. 19.115, Eup. 11.5 D. (prob.), Arist. HA 501b31 (pl.), PRyl. 280v (ii A. D.); grounds in gruel, Call. Fr. 205.
coarse loaf, AP 6.302 ( Leon.), Babr. 108.9.
crumbs, Herod. 6.6; κρίμνα χειρῶν, = ἀπομαγδαλιά, Lyc. 607.
PHolm. 8.43 ( κριμνον Pap.); κρημνός Ps.-Democr.Alch. p.42 B.; κριμνούς· λευκάς τινας βοτάνας, Hsch.
like coarse meal, of sediment in urine, Hp. Aph. 7.31; κ. ἑλλέβορος S.E. P. 1.130; κριμνώδη κατανείφειν snow thick as meal, Ar. Nu. 965.
houseleek, Hp. Nat.Mul. 32.
made of lilies, μύρον PMag.Lond. 46.223 (iv A. D.); ἔλαιον Gal. 11.872, PMag.Lond. 121.631 (iii A. D.); κ., τό, PMag.Leid.W. 9.13 (ii/iii A. D.).
like a lily, Dsc. 3.128. εις, εντος, ὁ, name of one of the Idaean Dactyls, Sch. Il. 22.391.

children.label: II
children.definition: εις, εσσα, εν, like a lily, κεραυνός dub. cj. in Supp.Epigr. 4.386 ( Panamara).

definition: κρίνον [ ῐ], τό, heterocl. pl. κρίνεα Hdt. 2.92; dat. κρίνεσιν Cratin. 98, Ar. Nu. 911, etc.:—

children.definition: white lily, Lilium candidum, Thphr. HP 6.6.8, Theoc. 11.56, Nic. Fr. 74.27, Dsc. 3.102; κ. πορφυροῦν Turkʼs cap lily, L. chalcedonicum, Thphr. HP 6.6.3, cf. Dsc. l.c.: prov., κρίνου γυμνότερος Jul. Or. 6.181c: hence, of a needy man, Poll. 6.197, etc.: symbolic of death, v. κολοκύντη.
Egyptian bean, Nelumbium speciosum, Hdt. 2.92.

children.label: II
children.definition: choral dance, Apolloph. 2.

children.label: III
children.definition: loaf, Ath. 3.114f.

children.label: IV
children.definition: architectural ornament, IG 11(2).161 A 72 ( Delos, iii B. C.).
lily-crowned, Aus. Ep. 8.14 ( κρινν-metri gr.).

definition: κρίνω [ῑ], Ep. 3 sg. ind. κρίνησι ( δια-) f.l. in Theoc. 25.46: fut. κρῐνῶ, Ep., Ion. κρῐνέω ( δια-) Il. 2.387: aor. ἔκρῑνα Od. 18.264, etc.: pf. κέκρῐκα Pl. Lg. 734c, etc.:— Med., fut. κρῐνοῦμαι E. Med. 609, but in pass. sense, Pl. Grg. 521e: aor. ἐκρῑνάμην Il. 9.521, etc.:— Pass., fut. κρῐθήσομαι A. Eu. 677, Antipho 6.37, etc.: aor. ἐκρίθην [ῐ] Pi. N. 7.7, etc.; 3 pl. κρίθεν Id. P. 4.168, ἔκριθεν A.R. 4.1462; Ep. opt. κρινθεῖτε ( δια-) Il. 3.102, part. κρινθείς 13.129, Od. 8.48, inf. κρινθήμεναι A.R. 2.148: pf. κέκρῐμαι Pi. O. 2.30, And. 4.35, etc.; inf. κεκρίσθαι ( ἀπο-) Pl. Men. 75c:— Aeol. κρίννω dub. in IG 12(2).278 (Mytil.): aor. ἔκριννε ib. 6.28 (Mytil., ἐπ-); inf. κρίνναι ib. 526b15:—Thess. pres. inf. κρεννέμεν ib. 9(2).517.14 ( Larissa):—

children.definition: separate, put asunder, distinguish, ὅτε τε ξανθὴ Δημήτηρ κρίνῃ . . καρπόν τε καὶ ἄχνας Il. 5.501, etc.; κρῖνʼ ἄνδρας κατὰ φῦλα 2.362. cf. 446; ἥλιος ἠὼ καὶ δύσιν ἔκρινεν Emp. 154.1; κ. τὸ ἀληθές τε καὶ μή Pl. Tht. 150b; τούς τε ἀγαθοὺς καὶ τοὺς κακούς X. Mem. 3.1.9, etc.:—also Med., ἀντία δʼ ἐκρίναντο δέμας καὶ σήματʼ ἔθεντο χωρὶς ἀπʼ ἀλλήλων Parm. 8.55:— Pass., κρινόμενον πῦρ Emp. 62.2.

data.quote: ὅτε τε ξανθὴ Δημήτηρ κρίνῃ . . καρπόν τε καὶ ἄχνας
κ. τὸ ἀληθές τε καὶ μή
τούς τε ἀγαθοὺς καὶ τοὺς κακούς
ἀντία δʼ ἐκρίναντο δέμας καὶ σήματʼ ἔθεντο χωρὶς ἀπʼ ἀλλήλων

children.label: II
children.definition: pick out, choose, ἐν δʼ ἐρέτας ἔκρινεν ἐείκοσιν Il. 1.309; ἐκ Λυκίης . . φῶτας ἀρίστους 6.188, cf. Od. 4.666, 9.90, 195, 14.217, etc.; κ. τινὰ ἐκ πάντων Hdt. 6.129; κρίνασα δʼ ἀστῶν . . τὰ βέλτατα A. Eu. 487; δίδωμί σοι κρίναντι χρῆσθαι S. OC 641, etc.:— Med., κρίνασθαι ἀρίστους to choose the best, Il. 9.521, cf. 19.193, Od. 4.408, 530, etc.:— Pass., to be chosen out, distinguished, ἵνα τε κρίνονται ἄριστοι 24.507; esp. in partt., κεκριμένος picked out, chosen, Il. 10.417, Od. 13.182, al., Hdt. 3.31; κρινθείς Il. 13.129, Od. 8.48; ἀρετᾷ κριθείς distinguished for . . , Pi. N. 7.7; κριθέντων ἐν τοῖς ἱερέοις approved . . , GDI 2049.15 (Delph.); ἀσπίδα . . κεκριμένην ὕδατι καὶ πολέμῳ proved by sea and land, AP 9.42 ( Leon.); ἐν ζῶσι κεκριμένα numbered among . . , cj. in E. Supp. 969 (lyr.); εἰς τοὺς ἐφήβους κριθείς Luc. Am. 2.

decide disputes, κρίνων νείκεα πολλά Od. 12.440; ἔκριναν μέγα νεῖκος . . πολέμοιο 18.264: c.acc. cogn., οἳ . . σκολιὰς κρίνωσι θέμιστας judge crooked judgements, Il. 16.387; κ. δίκας Hdt. 2.129; κρῖνε δʼ εὐθεῖαν δίκην A. Eu. 433, etc.; πρώτας δίκας κρίνοντες αἵματος ib. 682; κρινεῖ δὲ δὴ τίς ταῦτα; Ar. Ra. 805; κ. κρίσιν Pl. R. 360e; ἄριστα κ. Th. 6.39; κρίνουσι βοῇ καὶ οὐ ψήφῳ they decide the question . . , Id. 1.87; μίσει πλέον ἢ δίκῃ κ. Id. 3.67; τὸ δίκαιον κ. Isoc. 14.10; τῷ τοῦτο κρίνεις; by what do you form this judgement? Ar. Pl. 48; κ. περί τινος Pi. N. 5.40, Pl. Ap. 35d, Arist. Rh. 1391b9, etc.:— Pass., ἀγὼν κριθήσεται A. Eu. 677; κἂν ἰσόψηφος κριθῇ (sc. ἡ δίκη) ib. 741: impers., κριθησόμενον a decision being about to be taken, Arr. An. 3.9.6.

children.label: b
children.definition: decide a contest, e.g. for a prize, ἀγῶνα κ. Ar. Ra. 873; ἔργον ἐν κύβοις Ἄρης κρινεῖ A. Th. 414: c. acc. pers., κ. τὰς θεάς decide their contest, i.e. judge them, E. IA 72:— Pass., Id. Supp. 601 (lyr.); αἱ μάχαι κρίνονται ταῖς ψυχαῖς X. Cyr. 3.3.19:— Med. and Pass., of persons, have a contest decided, come to issue, κρινώμεθʼ Ἄρηϊ Il. 2.385, cf. 18.209; ὁπότε μνηστῆρσι καὶ ἡμῖν . . μένος κρίνηται Ἄρηος Od. 16.269; βίηφι κ. Hes. Th. 882; dispute, contend, Ar. Nu. 66; περὶ ἀρετῆς Hdt. 3.120; οὐ κρινοῦμαι . . σοι τὰ πλείονα E. Med. 609; δίκῃ περί τινος κρίνεσθαι Th. 4.122; κρίνεσθαι μετά τινος v.l. in LXX Jd. 8.1, Jb. 9.3; πολλαῖς μάχαις κριθείς Nic.Dam. 20 J.; compete in games, c. acc. cogn., κριθέντα Πύθια JRS 3.295 ( Antioch. Pisid.): pf. part., decided, clear, strong, κεκριμένος οὖρος Il. 14.19; πόνοι κεκρ. decided, ended, Pi. N. 4.1.

data.quote: ὁπότε μνηστῆρσι καὶ ἡμῖν . . μένος κρίνηται Ἄρηος

children.label: c
children.definition: win a battle, τὴν μάχην Ἀννίβας ἔκρινε Plb. 3.117.11.
adjudge, κράτος τινί S. Aj. 443:— Pass., τοῖς οὔτε νόστος . . κρίθη Pi. P. 8.84; τὰ κριθησόμενα the sum adjudged to be paid, PLips. 38.13 (iv A. D.).

children.label: b
children.definition: judge, give judgement, ἄκουσον . . καὶ κρῖνον Ar. Fr. 473; ἀδίκως κ. Pherecr. 96, cf. Men. Mon. 287, 576.

children.label: c
children.definition: bring to a crisis, τὸ θερμὸν φίλιόν [ἐστι] καὶ κρῖνον Hp. Aph. 5.22; κ. τὰ νοσήματα Gal. Nat. Fac. 1.13, al.:— Pass., of a sick person, come to a crisis, ἐκρίθη εἰκοσταῖος Hp. Epid. 1.15 (also impers. in Act., ἔκρινε τούτοισιν ἑνδεκαταίοισιν the crisis came . . , ib. 18); τοῦ πάθους κριθέντος D.S. 19.24.

judge of, estimate, πρὸς ἐμαυτὸν κρίνων [αὐτόν] judging of him by myself, D. 21.154; πρὸς ἀργύριον τὴν εὐδαιμονίαν κ. Isoc. 4.76:— Pass., ἴσον παρʼ ἐμοὶ κέκριται Hdt. 7.16.αʹ; εὔνοια καιρῷ κρίνεται Men. 691.
expound, interpret in a particular way, τὸ ἐνύπνιον ταύτῃ ἔκριναν Hdt. 1.120, cf. 7.19, A. Pr. 485, etc.:—in Med., ὁ γέρων ἐκρίνατʼ ὀνείρους Il. 5.150.

inf., decide or judge that . . , Hdt. 1.30, 214, Pl. Tht. 170d, etc.; κρίνω σὲ νικᾶν A. Ch. 903; so, with the inf. omitted, ἀνδρῶν πρῶτον κ. τινά S. OT 34; Ἔρωτα δʼ ὅστις μὴ θεὸν κρίνει μέγαν E. Fr. 269; τὴν πόλιν ἀθλιωτάτην ἔκρινας Pl. R. 578b; ἐκ τῶν λόγων μὴ κρῖνε . . σοφόν Philem. 228:— Pass., Ἑλλήνων ἕνα κριθέντʼ ἄριστον S. Ph. 1345, cf. Th. 2.40, etc.

data.quote: Ἔρωτα δʼ ὅστις μὴ θεὸν κρίνει μέγαν
ἐκ τῶν λόγων μὴ κρῖνε . . σοφόν

children.definition: decide in favour of, prefer, choose, κρίνω δʼ ἄφθονον ὄλβον A. Ag. 471, cf. Supp. 396 (both lyr.); τὴν ἐλπίδα τῆς τύχης πάρος S. Tr. 724; τινὰ πρό τινος Pl. R. 399e, cf. Phlb. 57e; τι πρός τι Id. Phd. 110a ( Pass.); εἴ σφε κρίνειεν Πάρις E. Tr. 928, cf. Ar. Av. 1103, Ec. 1155; choose between, δύʼ ἔσθʼ ἃ κρῖναι τὸν γαμεῖν μέλλοντα δεῖ, ἤτοι προσηνῆ γʼ ὄψιν ἢ χρηστὸν τρόπον Men. 584.

data.quote: δύʼ ἔσθʼ ἃ κρῖναι τὸν γαμεῖν μέλλοντα δεῖ, ἤτοι προσηνῆ γʼ ὄψιν ἢ χρηστὸν τρόπον

children.definition: inf.only, determine to do a thing, UPZ 42.37 (ii B. C.), Ep.Tit. 3.12, 1 Ep.Cor. 2.2, etc.; ζῆν μεθʼ ὧν κρίνῃ τις ἄν (sc. ζῆν) with whom he chooses to live, Men. 506; but τὸ βιάζεσθαι οὐκ ἔκρινε D.S. 15.32.
form a judgement of a thing, μὴ κρῖνʼ ὁρῶν τὸ κάλλος Men. Mon. 333.

children.label: III
children.definition: question, αὐτὸν . . ἅπας λεὼς κρίνει παραστάς S. Tr. 195; εἴ νιν πρὸς βίαν κρίνειν θέλοις ib. 388; καὶ κρῖνε κἀξέλεγχʼ Id. Ant. 399; μὴ κρῖνε, μὴ ʼξέταζε Id. Aj. 586; σέ τοι, σὲ κρίνω Id. El. 1445.

bring to trial, accuse, D. 2.29, 18.15, 19.233; κ. θανάτου judge (in matters) of life and death, X. Cyr. 1.2.14; κ. τινὰ προδοσίας Lycurg. 113; περὶ προδοσίας Isoc. 15.129; κ. τινὰ κακώσεως ἐπαρχίας, Lat. repetundarum, Plu. Caes. 4:— Pass., to be brought to trial, Th. 6.29; θανάτου ( δίκῃ add. cod. B) Id. 3.57; Λεωκράτους τοῦ κρινομένου Lycurg. 1; κρίνομαι πρὸς Σωφρόνην; Men. Epit. 529; τρὶς κρίνεται παρʼ ὑμῖν περὶ θανάτου D. 4.47; ἐκρίνετο τὴν περὶ Ὠρωποῦ κρίσιν θανάτου Id. 21.64: c. gen. criminis, κρίνεσθαι δώρων Lys. 27.3: κ. ἐπʼ ἀδικήματι Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.241e: abs., ὁ κεκριμένος Aeschin. 2.159.

data.quote: τρὶς κρίνεται παρʼ ὑμῖν περὶ θανάτου
ἐκρίνετο τὴν περὶ Ὠρωποῦ κρίσιν θανάτου

children.definition: pass sentence upon, condemn, D. 19.232:— Pass., to be judged, condemned, κακούργου . . ἐστι κριθέντʼ ἀποθανεῖν Id. 4.47; μὴ κρίνετε, ἵνα μὴ κριθῆτε Ev.Matt. 7.1; τὰ κεκριμένα the judgement of a court, PRyl. 76.8 (ii A. D.). ( κρῐ-ν-yω ἐ-κρῐ-ν-σα, cf. Lat. cerno (from *crǐ-n-), crībrum (from *crei-dhrom).)
bed of lilies, Suid.; but, = κρίνον, Thphr. HP 2.2.1, 6.6.9.
adorned with lilies, κεφαλίδες Aristeas 68.
sacrifice of a ram, IG 14.1018 (iv A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ephebic contest in which a ram was caught and sacrificed, OGI 764.27 ( Pergam., ii B. C.).
ram-slaying, κ. τελετή, = foreg. 1, IG 14.1018 (iv A. D.).

definition: κριογενής, ὁ, name of a lozenge, Paul.Aeg. 4.41, 7.12.

children.definition: frame of a battering-ram, Ath.Mech. 13.10, al.
like a ram, Suid. s.v. κριός.
with ramʼs horns, θεός Ps.-Callisth. 1.8.
ram-headed, Hermes Trism. in Rev.Phil. 32.254.
batter with a battering-ram, Plb. 1.42.9, App. Mith. 36: abs., Ath.Mech. 14.11, Apollod. Poliorc. 143.7.
manoeuvre with a battering-ram, Apollod. Poliorc. 185.14.
ram-formed, Sch.rec. A.R. 1.256.
like a drivelling ram, sheepish, Cerc. 15.
crion), = vervecina, Gloss. (Perh. contr. from *κρίειον (sc. κρέας).)
ram-faced, ἄγαλμα Διός Hdt. 2.42, 4.181; Ζεύς Luc. Sacr. 14, etc.
with a ram as figurehead, ναῦς Nymphis 18.

definition: κριόπρῳρος, ον, = foreg. 2, πλοῖον, σκάφος, Sch. Pl. Mx. 243a, Sch. A.R. 2.168.

children.definition: ram, Od. 9.447, 461, Hdt. 2.42, etc.; κριοὶ ἄγριοι Id. 4.192: prov., κριὸς τροφεῖα ἀπέτεισεν, of ingratitude, because a ram butts at those who have brought him up, Zen. 4.63, Suid., Hsch.; κριοὺς ἐκγεννᾶν τέκνα Eup. 99; κριοῦ διακονία, of thankless service, Suid., Hsch.; τὸν κριὸν ὡς ἐπέχθη the ‘shearing of the ram’, in allusion to the ode of Simonides in honour of Crius of Aegina, Ar. Nu. 1356.
battering-ram, X. Cyr. 7.4.1, IG 2(2).468, Plb. 1.48.9, Ath.Mech. 14.1, J. BJ 3.7.19, etc.
Aries, Eudox. ap. Hipparch. 1.2.13, Euc. Phaen. p.6 M., Arat. 238, J. AJ 3.10.5, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: sea-monster, Ael. NA 9.49, 15.2, Opp. H. 1.372, 5.33, etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: mussel, Hegesand. 36 ( κρεῖος cod. A Ath.).

children.label: IV
children.definition: volute on the Corinthian capital, twisted like a ramʼs horn, Hsch.

children.label: V
children.definition: ship, Poll. 1.83.

children.label: VI
children.definition: BGU 14iii9 (iii A. D.).

children.label: VII
children.definition: a variety of ἐρέβινθος, Thphr. HP 8.5.1, PCair.Zen. 192.8 (iii B. C.), Dsc. 2.104, Gal. 6.533: misspelt κρεῖος in Sophil. 8: Lat. cicer arietinum, Petron. 35, etc.; est enim arietino capiti simile, Plin. HN 18.124. (Prob. cogn. with κέρας.)
station, position for a battering-ram, Ph. Bel. 92.19.
one who buries sacred rams, PTeb. 72.411 (ii B. C.).
devouring rams, epith. of a divinity, Hsch.
carrying battering-rams, χελῶναι Ph. Bel. 99.44, Ath.Mech. 8.14, Apollod. Poliorc. 138.18, D.S. 20.48, 91; μηχαναί App. Pun. 98, Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. προσηρεικότος.

children.label: II
children.definition: bearing a ram, epith. of Hermes, Paus. 9.22.1.
made into a ram, Hsch. s.v. Γαλλίμ (ante γαιηούχῳ).

definition: Κρῖσα, ης, ἡ, Crisa, a city in Phocis, near Delphi, Il. 2.520; Κρίση, h.Ap. 282, etc.:— Adj. Κρισαῖος, α, ον, Crisaean, ib. 446, Hdt. 8.32:—also Κίρρα, Pi. P. 3.74, al., SIG 241.45, al. ( Delph., iv B. C.), Paus. 10.37.4 (but Κρῖσα distd. fr. Κίρρα by Leocrines ap. EM 515.20, Str. 9.3.3, Ptol. Geog. 3.14.4); Κύρρα, Marm.Par. 53, v.l. in Ptol. l.c.; Κίρσα, Alc. Oxy. 1789 Fr. 6.9 (dub.), EM l.c.; κόλπος Κιρραῖος, dub. in Hecat. 105 J.: also Κρί̆σα, Pi. I. 2.18; Κρῐσαῖος, Id. P. 5.37, al.
